TEXT.English: I yearn for a kingdom without gods or kings. Only men and women under none.
TEXT.French: Je me languis d'une patrie sans dieux ni rois. Rien que des hommes et des femmes émancipés.
TEXT.German: Ich sehne mich nach einem Reich ohne Götter oder Könige. Nur Männer und Frauen, niemandes Untertan.
TEXT.Italian: I yearn for a kingdom without gods or kings. Only men and women under none.
TEXT.Spanish: I yearn for a kingdom without gods or kings. Only men and women under none.

TEXT.English: Magnadine? A fool. Everyone thinks he's great, just because he can ride a freaking pony. I don't need a horse to kill people, isn't that even more impressive?
TEXT.French: Magnadine ? Un imbécile. Tout le monde pense qu'il est génial, juste parce qu'il chevauche un foutu poney. Je peux tuer des gens sans canasson, moi. C'est pas plus impressionnant ?
TEXT.German: Magnadine? Ein Narr. Alle halten ihn für ach so toll, bloß, weil er ein beklopptes Pony reiten kann. Ich benötige kein Pferd, um jemanden umzubringen - ist das denn nicht viel beeindruckender?
TEXT.Italian: Magnadine? A fool. Everyone thinks he's great, just because he can ride a freaking pony. I don't need a horse to kill people, isn't that even more impressive?
TEXT.Spanish: Magnadine? A fool. Everyone thinks he's great, just because he can ride a freaking pony. I don't need a horse to kill people, isn't that even more impressive?

TEXT.English: "We had trapped the thief in the corridor outside the library. 5th squad was to her left, and 2nd squad to her right. As I called on her to surrender, she reached into her backpack, which was stuffed with stolen spell scrolls, and pulled out a crystal rod. As the squad began shooting, she activated the rod. There was a blinding light and when we could see again, she was gone."[NEWLINE]--Ilnacht Vivordur, Svaltalfar 2nd Hunter Squad Leader - After action report
TEXT.French: "Nous avions acculé la voleuse dans un corridor jouxtant la bibliothèque. La 5me escouade bloquait le côté gauche, tandis que la 2me tenait la droite. Alors que je lui intimais l'ordre de se rendre, elle plongea la main dans son sac à dos, débordant de parchemins magiques volés, et en sortit une baguette de cristal. Le temps que l'escouade ouvre le feu, elle l'avait activée. Il y eut une lumière aveuglante. Le temps qu'on puisse voir à nouveau, elle avait disparu."[NEWLINE]--Ilnacht Vivordur, Chef de la 2nde escouade de Chasseurs Svaltalfar - Débriefing
TEXT.German: "Wir hatten den Dieb in dem Korridor außerhalb der Bibliothek festgesetzt. Das 5. Geschwader war zu ihrer linken, das 2. Geschwader zu ihrer rechten. Als ich sie aufforderte, zu kapitulieren, griff sie in ihren Rucksack, welcher vollgestopft war mit gestohlenen Spruchrollen, und zog ein Kristallszepter raus. Als die Geschwader zu schießen begannen, schwang sie das Szepter. Es gab ein grelles Licht, und als wir wieder sehen konnten, war sie verschwunden."[NEWLINE]--Ilnacht Vivordur, Anführer des Svaltalfarischen 2. Jägergeschwaders - Einsatznachbesprechung
TEXT.Italian: "We had trapped the thief in the corridor outside the library. 5th squad was to her left, and 2nd squad to her right. As I called on her to surrender, she reached into her backpack, which was stuffed with stolen spell scrolls, and pulled out a crystal rod. As the squad began shooting, she activated the rod. There was a blinding light and when we could see again, she was gone."[NEWLINE]--Ilnacht Vivordur, Svaltalfar 2nd Hunter Squad Leader - After action report
TEXT.Spanish: "We had trapped the thief in the corridor outside the library. 5th squad was to her left, and 2nd squad to her right. As I called on her to surrender, she reached into her backpack, which was stuffed with stolen spell scrolls, and pulled out a crystal rod. As the squad began shooting, she activated the rod. There was a blinding light and when we could see again, she was gone."[NEWLINE]--Ilnacht Vivordur, Svaltalfar 2nd Hunter Squad Leader - After action report

TEXT.English: He is an embittered mistheist, the sort of atheist who does not so much disbelieve in the gods and their agendas as personally dislike them. -- Interviewers notes penned on Carrow's Application for Citizenship
TEXT.French: C'est un misothéiste aigri, la sorte d'athée qui ne doute pas vraiment de leur existence ni de leurs projets, mais plutôt qui les déteste personnellement. -- Notes de l'entretien avec Carrow suite à sa demande de naturalisation
TEXT.German: Er ist ein verbitterter Un-Theist, die Sorte Atheist, die nicht so sehr die Existenz der Götter bezweifelt, als vielmehr diese selbst persönlich einfach zu verabscheuen.[NEWLINE]-- Notizen des Beamten verfasst auf Carrows Antrag für den Erhalt der Bürgerschaft
TEXT.Italian: He is an embittered mistheist, the sort of atheist who does not so much disbelieve in the gods and their agendas as personally dislike them. -- Interviewers notes penned on Carrow's Application for Citizenship
TEXT.Spanish: He is an embittered mistheist, the sort of atheist who does not so much disbelieve in the gods and their agendas as personally dislike them. -- Interviewers notes penned on Carrow's Application for Citizenship

TEXT.English: To this day the Grigori travel down the length of the serpent's canyon and offer small tokens to the stone mound at its end. This is a reminder of their own failure, and the screams of Khord Tenhare are said to still echo within the canyons walls.
TEXT.French: À ce jour, les Grigoris arpentent encore toute la longueur du canyon-serpent et offrent de petits symboles au tumulus de pierre qui marque sa fin. C'est une commémoration de leur échec. La rumeur prétend que l'écho des hurlements de Khord Tenhare peut encore être entendu entre les parois de ce canyon.
TEXT.German: Bis zum heutigen Tag pilgern die Grigori die gesamte Länge des Schlangencanyons entlang und bringen bei dem dort am Enge gelegenen Grabhügel kleine Opfer dar. Das ist eine Erinnerung an ihr eigenes Versagen - die Echos der Schreie von Khord Tenare sollen angeblich noch immer von den Wänden des Canyons widerhallen.
TEXT.Italian: To this day the Grigori travel down the length of the serpent's canyon and offer small tokens to the stone mound at its end. This is a reminder of their own failure, and the screams of Khord Tenhare are said to still echo within the canyons walls.
TEXT.Spanish: To this day the Grigori travel down the length of the serpent's canyon and offer small tokens to the stone mound at its end. This is a reminder of their own failure, and the screams of Khord Tenhare are said to still echo within the canyons walls.

TEXT.English: "...it came at me from the deep wilderness. I cursed my carelessness as it's canines went for my throat. With brute strength did I turn him, look into his eyes and butted him into the darkness" --Recounting of Pinchete's favorite tale, How I Tamed Gral, the Greatest Mount
TEXT.French: « ...Il a foncé vers moi, surgissant des broussailles. J'ai maudit mon insouciance, tandis que ses canines visaient ma gorge. J'ai usé de force brute pour le retourner ; je l'ai regardé droit dans les yeux et je l'ai assommé d'un coup de tête. » -- Histoire favorite de Pinchete, Comment j'ai dompté Gral, la Meilleure des montures
TEXT.German: "...aus den Tiefen der Wildnis kam es über mich. Ich verfluchte meine Sorglosigkeit, als seine Vorderzähne meinen Hals suchten. Mit aller Kraft habe ich ihn umgedreht, in seine Augen geschaut und ihn ins Reich der Träume geprügelt."[NEWLINE]-- Nacherzählung von Pinchets Lieblingsmärchen "Wie ich Gral zähmte, das Großartigste aller Reittiere"
TEXT.Italian: "...it came at me from the deep wilderness. I cursed my carelessness as it's canines went for my throat. With brute strength did I turn him, look into his eyes and butted him into the darkness" --Recounting of Pinchete's favorite tale, How I Tamed Gral, the Greatest Mount
TEXT.Spanish: "...it came at me from the deep wilderness. I cursed my carelessness as it's canines went for my throat. With brute strength did I turn him, look into his eyes and butted him into the darkness" --Recounting of Pinchete's favorite tale, How I Tamed Gral, the Greatest Mount

TEXT.English: Those idiots at Aeron's Bounty? Inefficient. Wasteful. Overpriced. They're cultists masquerading as assassins. They add pomp and ceremony to what is a very simple job. Me? You pay me, and tell me who you want dead. They end up dead
TEXT.French: Ces idiots à la solde d'Aeron ? Inefficaces, gaspilleurs, surcotés. Ce sont des cultistes travestis en assassins. Ils prennent un travail extrêmement simple et ils l'encombrent de cérémonies en grande pompe. Moi, vous me payez, et vous me dites qui doit mourir. Puis ils meurent.
TEXT.German: Dies Idioten auf Aerons Bounty? Ineffizient. Verschwenderisch. überbezahlt. Das sind Kultisten, die sich als Meuchelmörder verkleiden. Sie fügen Pomp und Zeremonial einer Sache hinzu, die im Grunde total simpel ist. Ich? Ihr bezahlt mich und erzählt mir, wen Ihr tot sehen wollt. Und diejenigen enden als Tote.
TEXT.Italian: Those idiots at Aeron's Bounty? Inefficient. Wasteful. Overpriced. They're cultists masquerading as assassins. They add pomp and ceremony to what is a very simple job. Me? You pay me, and tell me who you want dead. They end up dead
TEXT.Spanish: Those idiots at Aeron's Bounty? Inefficient. Wasteful. Overpriced. They're cultists masquerading as assassins. They add pomp and ceremony to what is a very simple job. Me? You pay me, and tell me who you want dead. They end up dead

TEXT.English: Bahamet calls it "subtlety." I call it sitting and chatting with overfed royal dandies until his enemies die of old age.[NEWLINE]--Panlupan
TEXT.French: Bahamet appelle ça la « subtilité ». J'appelle ça rester assis à bavasser avec des dandys royaux qui se goinfrent jusqu'à ce que ses ennemis meurent de vieillesse.[NEWLINE]--Panlupan
TEXT.German: Bahamet nennt es "Subtilität".Ich nenne es Herumsitzen mit verfetteten königlichen Laffen und Palavern, bis der Feind an seinem hohen Alter stirbt.[NEWLINE]--Panlupan
TEXT.Italian: Bahamet calls it "subtlety." I call it sitting and chatting with overfed royal dandies until his enemies die of old age.[NEWLINE]--Panlupan
TEXT.Spanish: Bahamet calls it "subtlety." I call it sitting and chatting with overfed royal dandies until his enemies die of old age.[NEWLINE]--Panlupan

TEXT.English: Now Groo does what Groo does best!
TEXT.French: Maintenant Groo va faire ce que Groo fait le mieux !
TEXT.German: Und nun Groo macht, was Groo macht gut!
TEXT.Italian: Now Groo does what Groo does best!
TEXT.Spanish: Now Groo does what Groo does best!

TEXT.English: The streets of Junon were said to be safer during the night than during the day. Cabal Tenhare and his hundreds of pet ravens watched over the sleeping city. If any crime was commited there would be only caws, a flurry of black wings and a black cloud would descend on the criminal.
TEXT.French: The streets of Junon were said to be safer during the night than during the day. Cabal Tenhare and his hundreds of pet ravens watched over the sleeping city. If any crime was commited there would be only caws, a flurry of black wings and a black cloud would descend on the criminal.
TEXT.German: Den Straßen von Junon wird nachgesagt, während der Nacht sicherer zu sein als zur Tageszeit. Cabal Tenhare und seine Hundertschaft zahmer Raben wachten über der Stadt. Sobald ein Verbrechen verübt werden würde, gäbe es bloß noch Gekrächze, ein Durcheinander aus schwarzen Flügeln, und eine schwarze Wolke würde auf den Delinquenten herabsinken.
TEXT.Italian: The streets of Junon were said to be safer during the night than during the day. Cabal Tenhare and his hundreds of pet ravens watched over the sleeping city. If any crime was commited there would be only caws, a flurry of black wings and a black cloud would descend on the criminal.
TEXT.Spanish: The streets of Junon were said to be safer during the night than during the day. Cabal Tenhare and his hundreds of pet ravens watched over the sleeping city. If any crime was commited there would be only caws, a flurry of black wings and a black cloud would descend on the criminal.

TEXT.English: "Her idea of tact is toasting the King before setting his palace on fire." --Bahamet the Second
TEXT.French: "Her idea of tact is toasting the King before setting his palace on fire." --Bahamet the Second
TEXT.German: "Ihre Vorstellung von Takt ist es, den König zu rösten BEVOR man seinen Palast in Brand steckt."[NEWLINE]--Bahamet der Zweite
TEXT.Italian: "Her idea of tact is toasting the King before setting his palace on fire." --Bahamet the Second
TEXT.Spanish: "Her idea of tact is toasting the King before setting his palace on fire." --Bahamet the Second

TEXT.English: The Bannor always brag about how their devotion to Junil allows them to ignore pain and other irritants... I've found this 'gift' allows my poisons to go unnoticed till it is too late for even the most proficent Confessors to save them.
TEXT.French: The Bannor always brag about how their devotion to Junil allows them to ignore pain and other irritants... I've found this 'gift' allows my poisons to go unnoticed till it is too late for even the most proficent Confessors to save them.
TEXT.German: Die Bannor prahlen immer damit, wie ihre Ergebenheit zu Junil es ihnen ermöglicht, Schmerz und andere Irritationen zu ignorieren... Ich habe herausgefunden, dass diese "Gabe" es meinen Giften erlaubt, solange unbemerkt zu bleiben, bis es sogar für den fähigsten Beichtvater zu spät ist, sie zu erretten.
TEXT.Italian: The Bannor always brag about how their devotion to Junil allows them to ignore pain and other irritants... I've found this 'gift' allows my poisons to go unnoticed till it is too late for even the most proficent Confessors to save them.
TEXT.Spanish: The Bannor always brag about how their devotion to Junil allows them to ignore pain and other irritants... I've found this 'gift' allows my poisons to go unnoticed till it is too late for even the most proficent Confessors to save them.

TEXT.English: I've come to understand a certain pattern in this life. The gods and Kings agree too often. If the King changes his mind then, miraculously, the gods seem to change theirs as well. When the time for war comes, the gods demand blood and martyrs. When the king wants to fatten himself on gold, the gods suddenly expect grand and expensive tribute. I don't know about the gods themselves, but religion is clearly an arm of the king, not the people.
TEXT.French: I've come to understand a certain pattern in this life. The gods and Kings agree too often. If the King changes his mind then, miraculously, the gods seem to change theirs as well. When the time for war comes, the gods demand blood and martyrs. When the king wants to fatten himself on gold, the gods suddenly expect grand and expensive tribute. I don't know about the gods themselves, but religion is clearly an arm of the king, not the people.
TEXT.German: "Ich bin an einem Punkt angelangt, an welchem ich ein gewisses Muster in diesem Leben erkenne. Die Götter und die Könige stimmen zu oft in ihrer Meinung überein. Wenn der König seine Meinung ändert - simsalabim - ändern die Götter die ihre ebenfalls. Wenn eine Zeit des Krieges angebrochen ist, fordern die Götter Blut und Märtyrer. Wenn der König sich selbst mit Gold mästen möchte, erwarten die Götter plötzlich großzügige und teure Gaben. Ich weiß nicht, wie es sich mit den Göttern so verhält, aber die Religion ist offensichtlich ein Arm des Königs, nicht des Volkes."[NEWLINE]-- Rede von Henserius Dünkelbyr, der Ketzerei beschuldigt, bei seiner Verteidigung vor dem Königlichen Gericht; aus dem Sammlband "Fatale Irrtümer und ebensolche Folgen" von L.R.A. Knytt
TEXT.Italian: I've come to understand a certain pattern in this life. The gods and Kings agree too often. If the King changes his mind then, miraculously, the gods seem to change theirs as well. When the time for war comes, the gods demand blood and martyrs. When the king wants to fatten himself on gold, the gods suddenly expect grand and expensive tribute. I don't know about the gods themselves, but religion is clearly an arm of the king, not the people.
TEXT.Spanish: I've come to understand a certain pattern in this life. The gods and Kings agree too often. If the King changes his mind then, miraculously, the gods seem to change theirs as well. When the time for war comes, the gods demand blood and martyrs. When the king wants to fatten himself on gold, the gods suddenly expect grand and expensive tribute. I don't know about the gods themselves, but religion is clearly an arm of the king, not the people.

TEXT.English: The clan is strong and Bhall is stronger, but I find that working alone makes certain jobs much simpler and entertaining to complete.
TEXT.French: The clan is strong and Bhall is stronger, but I find that working alone makes certain jobs much simpler and entertaining to complete.
TEXT.German: Der Clan ist stark und Bhall ist stärker, aber ich finde, allein zu arbeiten erleichtert die Vollendung gewisser Aufträge - und gestaltet sie auch durchaus interessanter.
TEXT.Italian: The clan is strong and Bhall is stronger, but I find that working alone makes certain jobs much simpler and entertaining to complete.
TEXT.Spanish: The clan is strong and Bhall is stronger, but I find that working alone makes certain jobs much simpler and entertaining to complete.

TEXT.English: I have learned that if there is any power in demonology, then it lay with the demons. Using it for your own purposes is like trying to beat mice to death with a rattlesnake.
TEXT.French: I have learned that if there is any power in demonology, then it lay with the demons. Using it for your own purposes is like trying to beat mice to death with a rattlesnake.
TEXT.German: Ich habe begriffen, dass, falls irgendeine Macht in der Dämonologie liegt, diese allein bei den Dämonen liegt. Sie für die eigenen Ziele einzusetzen, ist wie der Versuch, Mäuse mit einer Klapperschlange zu Tode zu Prügeln.
TEXT.Italian: I have learned that if there is any power in demonology, then it lay with the demons. Using it for your own purposes is like trying to beat mice to death with a rattlesnake.
TEXT.Spanish: I have learned that if there is any power in demonology, then it lay with the demons. Using it for your own purposes is like trying to beat mice to death with a rattlesnake.

TEXT.English: Some gods, like Nantosuelta and Sirona, are benevolent. Some are not. But in the end all they want is our obedience, not our well being.
TEXT.French: Some gods, like Nantosuelta and Sirona, are benevolent. Some are not. But in the end all they want is our obedience, not our well being.
TEXT.German: Einige Götter, wie z.B. Nantosuelta und Sirona, sind gütig. Andere sind's nicht. Aber letztendlich ist alles, was sie wollen, unser Gehorsam, und nicht unser Wohlbefinden.
TEXT.Italian: Some gods, like Nantosuelta and Sirona, are benevolent. Some are not. But in the end all they want is our obedience, not our well being.
TEXT.Spanish: Some gods, like Nantosuelta and Sirona, are benevolent. Some are not. But in the end all they want is our obedience, not our well being.

TEXT.English: Many people speak of the unique... Hunger... of the Calabim. Having lived among them long enough to share in this strange affliction I stand now as testament that it can be overcome, though the Hunger exists in all Lands, not just that of the Calabim. I speak of the Hunger for greater power over the people of Erebus... of what did you speak?
TEXT.French: Many people speak of the unique... Hunger... of the Calabim. Having lived among them long enough to share in this strange affliction I stand now as testament that it can be overcome, though the Hunger exists in all Lands, not just that of the Calabim. I speak of the Hunger for greater power over the people of Erebus... of what did you speak?
TEXT.German: Viele Menschen sprechen von dem einziartigen... Hunger... der Calabim. Nachdem ich lange genug unter ihnen gelebt habe, um an diesem seltsamen Drang teilzuhaben, stehe ich hier nun als lebender Beweis dafür, das dieser Hunger überwunden werden kann, obwohl er ja überall vorkommt, nicht nur bei den Calabim. Ich spreche von dem Hunger nach Macht über die Völker von Erebus... was dachtet Ihr?
TEXT.Italian: Many people speak of the unique... Hunger... of the Calabim. Having lived among them long enough to share in this strange affliction I stand now as testament that it can be overcome, though the Hunger exists in all Lands, not just that of the Calabim. I speak of the Hunger for greater power over the people of Erebus... of what did you speak?
TEXT.Spanish: Many people speak of the unique... Hunger... of the Calabim. Having lived among them long enough to share in this strange affliction I stand now as testament that it can be overcome, though the Hunger exists in all Lands, not just that of the Calabim. I speak of the Hunger for greater power over the people of Erebus... of what did you speak?

TEXT.English: Good... Bad... Maybe that Runekeeper was right after all; I'm just a traitor.
TEXT.French: Good... Bad... Maybe that Runekeeper was right after all; I'm just a traitor.
TEXT.German: Gut... Schlecht ... Womöglich hatte dieser Runenbewahrer letztenendes doch recht - ich bin nur ein Verräter.
TEXT.Italian: Good... Bad... Maybe that Runekeeper was right after all; I'm just a traitor.
TEXT.Spanish: Good... Bad... Maybe that Runekeeper was right after all; I'm just a traitor.

TEXT.English: I'm only laughing on the outside[NEWLINE]My smile is just skin deep[NEWLINE]If you could see inside I'm really crying[NEWLINE]You might join me for a weep.
TEXT.French: I'm only laughing on the outside[NEWLINE]My smile is just skin deep[NEWLINE]If you could see inside I'm really crying[NEWLINE]You might join me for a weep.
TEXT.German: Mein Lächeln mag echt erscheinen.[NEWLINE]Und doch ist es bloß schöner Schein.[NEWLINE]Mein Inneres ist stets am Weinen.[NEWLINE]Doch wenn Ihr mögt, kommt zu mir rein.
TEXT.Italian: I'm only laughing on the outside[NEWLINE]My smile is just skin deep[NEWLINE]If you could see inside I'm really crying[NEWLINE]You might join me for a weep.
TEXT.Spanish: I'm only laughing on the outside[NEWLINE]My smile is just skin deep[NEWLINE]If you could see inside I'm really crying[NEWLINE]You might join me for a weep.

TEXT.English: Beyond the abyss of mortality is only the shining beacon of permanence. Living beings are attracted to its light like moths to the flame and the end result is the same for moth and human alike.
TEXT.French: Beyond the abyss of mortality is only the shining beacon of permanence. Living beings are attracted to its light like moths to the flame and the end result is the same for moth and human alike.
TEXT.German: Jenseits des Abgrunds der Sterblichkeit gibt es nur den Funken der Beständigkeit. Menschen werden davon genauso angezogen, wie Motten vom Licht, und das Endergebnis für Mensch und Motte ist letzlich auch das gleiche.
TEXT.Italian: Beyond the abyss of mortality is only the shining beacon of permanence. Living beings are attracted to its light like moths to the flame and the end result is the same for moth and human alike.
TEXT.Spanish: Beyond the abyss of mortality is only the shining beacon of permanence. Living beings are attracted to its light like moths to the flame and the end result is the same for moth and human alike.

TEXT.English: Revolutionary songs are like embers from a campfire, scattered by the wind. Most will be smothered before leaving their mark on the world; but once in a while, one will catch on a twig or a leaf, and before long the whole forest is aflame.
TEXT.French: Revolutionary songs are like embers from a campfire, scattered by the wind. Most will be smothered before leaving their mark on the world; but once in a while, one will catch on a twig or a leaf, and before long the whole forest is aflame.
TEXT.German: Revolutionäre Lieder sind wie glühende Funken eines Lagerfeuers, vom Winde verweht. Die meisten werden zu Staub, bevor sie ihr Ziel erreichen; aber hin und wieder landet eines auf einem Zweig oder Blatt, und nicht lange danach steht der ganze Wald in Flammen.
TEXT.Italian: Revolutionary songs are like embers from a campfire, scattered by the wind. Most will be smothered before leaving their mark on the world; but once in a while, one will catch on a twig or a leaf, and before long the whole forest is aflame.
TEXT.Spanish: Revolutionary songs are like embers from a campfire, scattered by the wind. Most will be smothered before leaving their mark on the world; but once in a while, one will catch on a twig or a leaf, and before long the whole forest is aflame.

TEXT.English: Music proves that the mind gravitates towards patterns. Consider the beauty of the major chords, or the augmented fifths, or that a phrase must always end with the note on which it started. Deviation from these established rules unnerves us-- in this, even the brutal Doviello make a concession to order.
TEXT.French: Music proves that the mind gravitates towards patterns. Consider the beauty of the major chords, or the augmented fifths, or that a phrase must always end with the note on which it started. Deviation from these established rules unnerves us-- in this, even the brutal Doviello make a concession to order.
TEXT.German: Die Musik beweist, dass sich die Seele in Mustern bewegt. Bedenke die Schönheit von Akkorden, von übermäßigen Quinten, oder dass eine Phrasie immer wieder mit dem Anfangston endet. Eine Abweichung von diesen Regeln stört uns - daher folgen sogar die brutalen Doviello dieser Ordnung.
TEXT.Italian: Music proves that the mind gravitates towards patterns. Consider the beauty of the major chords, or the augmented fifths, or that a phrase must always end with the note on which it started. Deviation from these established rules unnerves us-- in this, even the brutal Doviello make a concession to order.
TEXT.Spanish: Music proves that the mind gravitates towards patterns. Consider the beauty of the major chords, or the augmented fifths, or that a phrase must always end with the note on which it started. Deviation from these established rules unnerves us-- in this, even the brutal Doviello make a concession to order.

TEXT.English: War is the mother of all things.
TEXT.French: War is the mother of all things.
TEXT.German: Krieg ist die Mutter aller Dinge.
TEXT.Italian: War is the mother of all things.
TEXT.Spanish: War is the mother of all things.

TEXT.English: Make a fire for a man, you warm him for a day. Make a fire of a man, you warm him for his lifetime
TEXT.French: Allumez un feu pour un homme et vous le réchaufferez pour une journée. Mettez un homme en feu, et vous le réchaufferez pour le reste de son existence.
TEXT.German: Setzt einen Mann ans Feuer, und er hat es warm für einen Tag. Setzt einen Mann in Brand, und er hat es warm für den Rest seines Lebens.
TEXT.Italian: Make a fire for a man, you warm him for a day. Make a fire of a man, you warm him for his lifetime
TEXT.Spanish: Make a fire for a man, you warm him for a day. Make a fire of a man, you warm him for his lifetime

TEXT.English: The socialites shake their heads at my work, whispering that art should be pleasing to the eye. Bollocks, I say. If nature wanted her children to be shielded from her cruelty, she wouldn't have given us eyes with which to see it, or a brush with which to paint it.[NEWLINE]--From an address to the Avelorn Conservatory
TEXT.French: The socialites shake their heads at my work, whispering that art should be pleasing to the eye. Bollocks, I say. If nature wanted her children to be shielded from her cruelty, she wouldn't have given us eyes with which to see it, or a brush with which to paint it.[NEWLINE]--From an address to the Avelorn Conservatory
TEXT.German: Die feine Gesellschaft schüttelt ihren Kopf über meine Arbeiten, flüstert, dass Kunst dem Auge schmeicheln sollte. Totaler Schwachsinn, sage ich. Wenn die Natur gewollt hätte, dass ihre Kinder behütet sind vor Grausamkeit, hätte sie uns keine Augen gegeben, sie zu sehen, oder gar Pinsel, um sie zu malen.[NEWLINE]-- Aus einem Anschreiben an das Avelon Konservatorium
TEXT.Italian: The socialites shake their heads at my work, whispering that art should be pleasing to the eye. Bollocks, I say. If nature wanted her children to be shielded from her cruelty, she wouldn't have given us eyes with which to see it, or a brush with which to paint it.[NEWLINE]--From an address to the Avelorn Conservatory
TEXT.Spanish: The socialites shake their heads at my work, whispering that art should be pleasing to the eye. Bollocks, I say. If nature wanted her children to be shielded from her cruelty, she wouldn't have given us eyes with which to see it, or a brush with which to paint it.[NEWLINE]--From an address to the Avelorn Conservatory

TEXT.English: The greatest works of our time are composed of pain and suffering. Who better then to create great masterpieces than those who wandered the bowels of hell itself?
TEXT.French: The greatest works of our time are composed of pain and suffering. Who better then to create great masterpieces than those who wandered the bowels of hell itself?
TEXT.German: Die herausragendsten Arbeiten unserer Zeit bestehen aus Schmerz und Leid. Wer wäre denn zur Schöpfung von Meisterwerken besser geeignet, als diejenigen, die durch das Innerste der Hölle selbst gegangen sind?
TEXT.Italian: The greatest works of our time are composed of pain and suffering. Who better then to create great masterpieces than those who wandered the bowels of hell itself?
TEXT.Spanish: The greatest works of our time are composed of pain and suffering. Who better then to create great masterpieces than those who wandered the bowels of hell itself?

TEXT.English: ...it was clearly to be no ordinary summoning; the rituals here were not to gain powerful demons, as before, but rather to procure the legendary Samawen, greatest bard of the First Age. As she floated through the planar gate, she sang, in an unknown language, but with a hopelessness so profound that half the men present --hardened ritualists all-- were sobbing bitterly by the last stanza. I do not know what she had seen in the Great Beyond, to make her despair so. I'm not sure I want to know.[NEWLINE]--Nosamonce, Memoirs
TEXT.French: ...it was clearly to be no ordinary summoning; the rituals here were not to gain powerful demons, as before, but rather to procure the legendary Samawen, greatest bard of the First Age. As she floated through the planar gate, she sang, in an unknown language, but with a hopelessness so profound that half the men present --hardened ritualists all-- were sobbing bitterly by the last stanza. I do not know what she had seen in the Great Beyond, to make her despair so. I'm not sure I want to know.[NEWLINE]--Nosamonce, Memoirs
TEXT.German: ...es war offensichtlich eine ordinäre Beschwörung; die Rituale hier waren nicht gedacht, um mächtige Dämonen zu erhalten, wie zuvor, sondern um die legendäre Samawen, die größte Bardin des Ersten Zeitalters, zu beschwören. Als sie durch das Planare Tor glitt, sang sie, in einer unbekannten Sprache zwar, aber mit so tiefgründiger Hoffnungslosigkeit, dass die Hälfte aller anwesenden Männer - sie alle abgehärtete Ritualisten - nach dem Verklingen der letzten Note in bitterliches Schluchzen ausbrachen. Ich weiss nicht, was sie auf der Anderen Seite gesehen hat, dass sie so verzweifelt war. Ich bin auch nicht sicher, ob ich's wissen will.[NEWLINE]--Nosamonce, Memoiren
TEXT.Italian: ...it was clearly to be no ordinary summoning; the rituals here were not to gain powerful demons, as before, but rather to procure the legendary Samawen, greatest bard of the First Age. As she floated through the planar gate, she sang, in an unknown language, but with a hopelessness so profound that half the men present --hardened ritualists all-- were sobbing bitterly by the last stanza. I do not know what she had seen in the Great Beyond, to make her despair so. I'm not sure I want to know.[NEWLINE]--Nosamonce, Memoirs
TEXT.Spanish: ...it was clearly to be no ordinary summoning; the rituals here were not to gain powerful demons, as before, but rather to procure the legendary Samawen, greatest bard of the First Age. As she floated through the planar gate, she sang, in an unknown language, but with a hopelessness so profound that half the men present --hardened ritualists all-- were sobbing bitterly by the last stanza. I do not know what she had seen in the Great Beyond, to make her despair so. I'm not sure I want to know.[NEWLINE]--Nosamonce, Memoirs

TEXT.English: As she swept about the stage, the crowd was silent with a breathless joy. Every pose, every movement was... art. Her garments swirled and flowed as though they, too, were performers in their own right, shifting in patterns of color that spoke to the onlookers in a voice almost of their own. All of us were entranced. Which is why not a soul among us marked Pelia's associates as they slipped through the crowd, divesting us of our jewels and coinpurses.[NEWLINE]-- Casper Turnis, following the one-night-only performance of Pelia the Dancer
TEXT.French: As she swept about the stage, the crowd was silent with a breathless joy. Every pose, every movement was... art. Her garments swirled and flowed as though they, too, were performers in their own right, shifting in patterns of color that spoke to the onlookers in a voice almost of their own. All of us were entranced. Which is why not a soul among us marked Pelia's associates as they slipped through the crowd, divesting us of our jewels and coinpurses.[NEWLINE]-- Casper Turnis, following the one-night-only performance of Pelia the Dancer
TEXT.German: Als sie über die Bühne fegte, hielt die Menge vor Entzückung den Atem an. Jede Pose, jede Bewegung war... reine Kunst. Ihe Kleidungsstücke wirbelten und flossen, als wären auch sie Darsteller ihrer eigenen Sache, wechselnd in der Farbe, die zu dem Betrachter beinahe mit eigener Stimme zu sprechen schienen. Jeder von uns war wie benommen. Was der Grund dafür ist, warum keiner von uns Pelias Gefährten bermerkte, die durch die Menge glitten und uns unserer Juwelen und Geldbeutel beraubten.[NEWLINE]-- Casper Turnis, die eine-Nacht-nur Vorstellungen von Pelia der Tänzerin nachvollziehend
TEXT.Italian: As she swept about the stage, the crowd was silent with a breathless joy. Every pose, every movement was... art. Her garments swirled and flowed as though they, too, were performers in their own right, shifting in patterns of color that spoke to the onlookers in a voice almost of their own. All of us were entranced. Which is why not a soul among us marked Pelia's associates as they slipped through the crowd, divesting us of our jewels and coinpurses.[NEWLINE]-- Casper Turnis, following the one-night-only performance of Pelia the Dancer
TEXT.Spanish: As she swept about the stage, the crowd was silent with a breathless joy. Every pose, every movement was... art. Her garments swirled and flowed as though they, too, were performers in their own right, shifting in patterns of color that spoke to the onlookers in a voice almost of their own. All of us were entranced. Which is why not a soul among us marked Pelia's associates as they slipped through the crowd, divesting us of our jewels and coinpurses.[NEWLINE]-- Casper Turnis, following the one-night-only performance of Pelia the Dancer

TEXT.English: The performer was nondescript in appearance, except for eyes that shone with an eldritch darkness; but worse than his own eyes were the eyes of the crowd, which looked upon him as though he were their hero, their king, and their god.[NEWLINE]--Branding, on Argases' performance in a Grigori border town.
TEXT.French: The performer was nondescript in appearance, except for eyes that shone with an eldritch darkness; but worse than his own eyes were the eyes of the crowd, which looked upon him as though he were their hero, their king, and their god.[NEWLINE]--Branding, on Argases' performance in a Grigori border town.
TEXT.German: Der Erscheinung des Darstellers war nicht beschreibbar, abgesehen von den Augen, die in einer gespenstischen Dunkelheit leuchteten; aber schlimmer als seine eigenen Augen waren die Augen der Menge, die ihn anblickte, als wäre er ihr Held, ihr König - und ihr Gott.[NEWLINE]--Branding, über Argases' Auftritt in einer Grigorischen Grenzstadt
TEXT.Italian: The performer was nondescript in appearance, except for eyes that shone with an eldritch darkness; but worse than his own eyes were the eyes of the crowd, which looked upon him as though he were their hero, their king, and their god.[NEWLINE]--Branding, on Argases' performance in a Grigori border town.
TEXT.Spanish: The performer was nondescript in appearance, except for eyes that shone with an eldritch darkness; but worse than his own eyes were the eyes of the crowd, which looked upon him as though he were their hero, their king, and their god.[NEWLINE]--Branding, on Argases' performance in a Grigori border town.

TEXT.English: Seeing Beauty meakes you feel Beautiful. Seeing Tragedy makes you feel sad. Seeing yourself... Well if you look long enough, you may find who you really are.
TEXT.French: Seeing Beauty meakes you feel Beautiful. Seeing Tragedy makes you feel sad. Seeing yourself... Well if you look long enough, you may find who you really are.
TEXT.German: Schönheit zu sehen, lässt Euch Euch schöner fühlen. Tragisches zu sehen, lässt Euch traurig werden. Euch selbst zu sehen... nun, wenn Ihr lang genug hinseht, findet Ihr vielleicht heraus, wer Ihr wirklich seid.
TEXT.Italian: Seeing Beauty meakes you feel Beautiful. Seeing Tragedy makes you feel sad. Seeing yourself... Well if you look long enough, you may find who you really are.
TEXT.Spanish: Seeing Beauty meakes you feel Beautiful. Seeing Tragedy makes you feel sad. Seeing yourself... Well if you look long enough, you may find who you really are.

TEXT.English: "Aye two hundred strong we was, marchin' on da mad clown's city. They had no resistance, hells they was holdin' parties for us! Dey led us to da big carnival tent, and... he came wit' da lute wit' 12 strings... Only 6 of us survived."[NEWLINE]-Captain Harzak Stonehammer on the... amazing music of Vernadot.
TEXT.French: "Aye two hundred strong we was, marchin' on da mad clown's city. They had no resistance, hells they was holdin' parties for us! Dey led us to da big carnival tent, and... he came wit' da lute wit' 12 strings... Only 6 of us survived."[NEWLINE]-Captain Harzak Stonehammer on the... amazing music of Vernadot.
TEXT.German: "Ay, wir war'n zweihundert, die wir auf die Stadt des irren Clowns zumarschiert'n. Sie ham sich nich' gewehrt, sie ham 'n verdammtes Fest für uns vorbereitet! Sie ham uns in des große Jahrmarktszelt geführt, und ... er kam mit der Laute, 12 Saiten stark ... nur sechs von uns ham überlebt."[NEWLINE]-Hauptmann Harzak Steinhammer über die... ungewöhnliche Musik von Vernadot.
TEXT.Italian: "Aye two hundred strong we was, marchin' on da mad clown's city. They had no resistance, hells they was holdin' parties for us! Dey led us to da big carnival tent, and... he came wit' da lute wit' 12 strings... Only 6 of us survived."[NEWLINE]-Captain Harzak Stonehammer on the... amazing music of Vernadot.
TEXT.Spanish: "Aye two hundred strong we was, marchin' on da mad clown's city. They had no resistance, hells they was holdin' parties for us! Dey led us to da big carnival tent, and... he came wit' da lute wit' 12 strings... Only 6 of us survived."[NEWLINE]-Captain Harzak Stonehammer on the... amazing music of Vernadot.

TEXT.English: ...from the time the Khazad ventured to the surface, Clairone has bombarded passerby for miles around with enthusiastic yodeling, ostensibly to guide travelers and merchants to the Underhome. I sometimes wonder if it's actually to keep them away.[NEWLINE]--Nosamonce, Memoirs
TEXT.French: ...from the time the Khazad ventured to the surface, Clairone has bombarded passerby for miles around with enthusiastic yodeling, ostensibly to guide travelers and merchants to the Underhome. I sometimes wonder if it's actually to keep them away.[NEWLINE]--Nosamonce, Memoirs
TEXT.German: ...seit der Zeit der Ankunft der Khazad auf der Oberfläche hat Clairone Reisende in großem Umkreis mit einem enthusiastischen Jodeln genervt, offensichtlich, um Reisende und Händler nach Unterheim zu fähren. Ich frage mich manchmal, ob er es nicht tut, um Leute eigentlich fernzuhalten[NEWLINE]--Nosamonce, Memoiren
TEXT.Italian: ...from the time the Khazad ventured to the surface, Clairone has bombarded passerby for miles around with enthusiastic yodeling, ostensibly to guide travelers and merchants to the Underhome. I sometimes wonder if it's actually to keep them away.[NEWLINE]--Nosamonce, Memoirs
TEXT.Spanish: ...from the time the Khazad ventured to the surface, Clairone has bombarded passerby for miles around with enthusiastic yodeling, ostensibly to guide travelers and merchants to the Underhome. I sometimes wonder if it's actually to keep them away.[NEWLINE]--Nosamonce, Memoirs

TEXT.English: Your Bannor poets create great works in the name of sacrifice. Am I truly so different? My canvas is the flesh and my ink your lifeblood. Just because my sculptures beg me for mercy does not make the sacrifice any less powerful
TEXT.French: Your Bannor poets create great works in the name of sacrifice. Am I truly so different? My canvas is the flesh and my ink your lifeblood. Just because my sculptures beg me for mercy does not make the sacrifice any less powerful
TEXT.German: Eure Bannor Poeten erschaffen große Kunstwerke im Namung der Aufopferung. Bin ich wirklich so anders? Meine Leinwand ist die Haut und meine Tinte ist Euer Lebenssaft. Nur weil meine Skulpturen um Gnade flehen, macht das doch die Aufopferung nicht weniger bedeutend, oder etwa nicht?
TEXT.Italian: Your Bannor poets create great works in the name of sacrifice. Am I truly so different? My canvas is the flesh and my ink your lifeblood. Just because my sculptures beg me for mercy does not make the sacrifice any less powerful
TEXT.Spanish: Your Bannor poets create great works in the name of sacrifice. Am I truly so different? My canvas is the flesh and my ink your lifeblood. Just because my sculptures beg me for mercy does not make the sacrifice any less powerful

TEXT.English: To truely inspire the Mad King, new art is required, born of the unusual, the wanton, the unexpected!
TEXT.French: To truely inspire the Mad King, new art is required, born of the unusual, the wanton, the unexpected!
TEXT.German: Um den Verrückten König zu inspirieren, braucht es eine neue Kunstrichtung, aus dem Ungewöhnlichen heraus geboren, ein Dirne, etwas unerwartetes!
TEXT.Italian: To truely inspire the Mad King, new art is required, born of the unusual, the wanton, the unexpected!
TEXT.Spanish: To truely inspire the Mad King, new art is required, born of the unusual, the wanton, the unexpected!

TEXT.English: The best art comes out of intense suffering. My Muse provides an opportunity to harness the greatest such source.
TEXT.French: The best art comes out of intense suffering. My Muse provides an opportunity to harness the greatest such source.
TEXT.German: Die beste Kunst entspringt dem intensiven Leiden. Meine Muse stellt mir dabei die beste all solcher Quellen zur Verfügung.
TEXT.Italian: The best art comes out of intense suffering. My Muse provides an opportunity to harness the greatest such source.
TEXT.Spanish: The best art comes out of intense suffering. My Muse provides an opportunity to harness the greatest such source.

TEXT.English: Some say the gods are unknowable, others say their will is obvious. Me, I will stick to teaching all people of themselves, simply letting them chose the lyrics to my songs.
TEXT.French: Some say the gods are unknowable, others say their will is obvious. Me, I will stick to teaching all people of themselves, simply letting them chose the lyrics to my songs.
TEXT.German: Man einer sagt, die Götter kann man nicht verstehen. Andere sagen, ihr Wille sei offenkundig. Ich selbst versuche lieber, die Menschen dazu zu bringen, sich selbst zu verstehen. Sie selbst schaffen die Verse zu meinen Liedern.
TEXT.Italian: Some say the gods are unknowable, others say their will is obvious. Me, I will stick to teaching all people of themselves, simply letting them chose the lyrics to my songs.
TEXT.Spanish: Some say the gods are unknowable, others say their will is obvious. Me, I will stick to teaching all people of themselves, simply letting them chose the lyrics to my songs.

TEXT.English: Every soul has it's own song and the body it's instrument. The key to making it sound is knowing where to strum and prod.
TEXT.French: Every soul has it's own song and the body it's instrument. The key to making it sound is knowing where to strum and prod.
TEXT.German: Jede Seele hat ihr eigenes Lied und der Körper ist das Instrument. Das Geheimnis ist, zu wissen, wo man drücken und wo man ziehen muss.
TEXT.Italian: Every soul has it's own song and the body it's instrument. The key to making it sound is knowing where to strum and prod.
TEXT.Spanish: Every soul has it's own song and the body it's instrument. The key to making it sound is knowing where to strum and prod.

TEXT.English: Oddly enough, smoke and mirrors are more impressively "magical" than true magic ever has been.
TEXT.French: Bizarrement, la fumée et les miroirs montrent une « magie » plus impressionnante que tout ce qui forme la vraie magie.
TEXT.German: Seltsamerweise sind Rauch und ein paar Spiegel immer beeindruckender als es echte Magie jemals war.
TEXT.Italian: Oddly enough, smoke and mirrors are more impressively "magical" than true magic ever has been.
TEXT.Spanish: Oddly enough, smoke and mirrors are more impressively "magical" than true magic ever has been.

TEXT.English: With all your trinkets and titles, are any of you really happy? What has civilization done but told you to keep going forward and climbing higher till the day you die? Civilization feeds you? My body may often go hungry in seclusion, but my soul is forever fed.
TEXT.French: With all your trinkets and titles, are any of you really happy? What has civilization done but told you to keep going forward and climbing higher till the day you die? Civilization feeds you? My body may often go hungry in seclusion, but my soul is forever fed.
TEXT.German: Mit all Euren Schmuckstücken und Titeln seid Ihr wirklich glücklich? Was hat uns die zivilisierte Welt anderes gezeigt als, dass man immer weiter nach vorn gehen muss und höher klettern muss bis zum Tag des eigenen Todes? Das ernährt dich? Mein Körper mag manchmal hungrig sein, doch meine Seele ist immer satt. Und deine?
TEXT.Italian: With all your trinkets and titles, are any of you really happy? What has civilization done but told you to keep going forward and climbing higher till the day you die? Civilization feeds you? My body may often go hungry in seclusion, but my soul is forever fed.
TEXT.Spanish: With all your trinkets and titles, are any of you really happy? What has civilization done but told you to keep going forward and climbing higher till the day you die? Civilization feeds you? My body may often go hungry in seclusion, but my soul is forever fed.

TEXT.English: You ask what gives us the right of conquest? It is very simple, actually: it is because we win. Were we to lose, History would place us alongside the Doviello as barbarians. History is written by the winner.
TEXT.French: You ask what gives us the right of conquest? It is very simple, actually: it is because we win. Were we to lose, History would place us alongside the Doviello as barbarians. History is written by the winner.
TEXT.German: Ihr fragt, was uns das Recht gibt für Eroberungszüge? Das ist sehr einfach, tatsächlich verhält es sich so: weil wir gewinnen. Würden wir verlieren, wäre unser Platz in der Geschichte der neben den Doviello, als Barbaren. Geschichte wird vom Sieger geschrieben.
TEXT.Italian: You ask what gives us the right of conquest? It is very simple, actually: it is because we win. Were we to lose, History would place us alongside the Doviello as barbarians. History is written by the winner.
TEXT.Spanish: You ask what gives us the right of conquest? It is very simple, actually: it is because we win. Were we to lose, History would place us alongside the Doviello as barbarians. History is written by the winner.

TEXT.English: Some men intend to live forever by being the greatest general ever, others by becoming the greatest artist, or sage, or explorer. Me? I intend to live forever by not dying.
TEXT.French: Some men intend to live forever by being the greatest general ever, others by becoming the greatest artist, or sage, or explorer. Me? I intend to live forever by not dying.
TEXT.German: Einige Männer haben beschlossen, ewig zu leben, indem sie der größte Feldherr aller Zeiten werden, andere, indem sie der bekannteste Barde, Seher oder Erkunder werden.
TEXT.Italian: Some men intend to live forever by being the greatest general ever, others by becoming the greatest artist, or sage, or explorer. Me? I intend to live forever by not dying.
TEXT.Spanish: Some men intend to live forever by being the greatest general ever, others by becoming the greatest artist, or sage, or explorer. Me? I intend to live forever by not dying.

TEXT.English: Experience, that most brutal of teachers. But you learn, my God do you learn.
TEXT.French: L'expérience est un professeur brutal, mais on apprend, mon Dieu comme on apprend !
TEXT.German: Erfahrung, der brutalste aller Lehrmeister. Aber Ihr lernt, bei Gott, und wie Ihr lernt.
TEXT.Italian: Experience, that most brutal of teachers. But you learn, my God do you learn.
TEXT.Spanish: Experience, that most brutal of teachers. But you learn, my God do you learn.

TEXT.English: When they come to engage, disappear into the trees. When they retreat to camp, pepper their tents and cook-fires with arrows. When they can no longer sleep for fear of knives in the night, when they grow weary and frustrated and careless, when they march in disorder, then, and only then, will we unleash hell.
TEXT.French: When they come to engage, disappear into the trees. When they retreat to camp, pepper their tents and cook-fires with arrows. When they can no longer sleep for fear of knives in the night, when they grow weary and frustrated and careless, when they march in disorder, then, and only then, will we unleash hell.
TEXT.German: Wenn sie angreifen, versteckt euch in den Bäumen. Wenn sie sich zurückziehen, spcikt ihre Lagerfeuer und Zelte mit Pfeilen. Wenn sie aus Angst vor unseren Messer bei Nacht nicht mehr schlafen können, wenn sie müde, frustriert und unvorsichtig werden, wenn sie ungeordnet weitermarschieren, dann, und nur dann, werden wir die Hölle auf sie loslassen.
TEXT.Italian: When they come to engage, disappear into the trees. When they retreat to camp, pepper their tents and cook-fires with arrows. When they can no longer sleep for fear of knives in the night, when they grow weary and frustrated and careless, when they march in disorder, then, and only then, will we unleash hell.
TEXT.Spanish: When they come to engage, disappear into the trees. When they retreat to camp, pepper their tents and cook-fires with arrows. When they can no longer sleep for fear of knives in the night, when they grow weary and frustrated and careless, when they march in disorder, then, and only then, will we unleash hell.

TEXT.English: The testimony has been heard and a just decision has been made. Lita of Alexandria will be exiled from the Empire. This exile will be initiated by throwing her from the Cliffs of Hastur. Like the crow, Lita will take flight.[NEWLINE] If she falls to her death, she may be given an Order funeral. If not, then any punishment we can give will not equal the fate she will eventually suffer...
TEXT.French: Les témoignages ont été entendus et une décision juste a été prise. Lita d'Alexandrie sera exilée de l'Empire. Cet exil sera mis en ouvre en la jetant du haut des falaises d'Hastur. Tel le corbeau, Lita prendra son envol.[NEWLINE]Si elle succombe à sa chute, elle aura droit à des funérailles suivant les rites de l'Ordre. Dans le cas contraire, toute punition que nous pourrions lui faire subir ne saurait égaler [fin = brouillon] le destin tragique dont elle souffrira finalement.
TEXT.German: Die Zeugenaussage wurde gehört und eine Entscheidung wurde gefällt. Lita von Alexandria wird aus dem Reich verbannt. Die Verbannung beginnt mit dem Stoß von den Klippen von Hastur. Wie eine Krähe wird Lita fliegen.[NEWLINE] Falls sie in den Tod stürzt, erhält sie ein ordentliches Begräbnis. Falls nicht, kann keine unserer Strafen an das heranreichen, was sie irgendwann einmal zu leiden hat...
TEXT.Italian: The testimony has been heard and a just decision has been made. Lita of Alexandria will be exiled from the Empire. This exile will be initiated by throwing her from the Cliffs of Hastur. Like the crow, Lita will take flight.[NEWLINE] If she falls to her death, she may be given an Order funeral. If not, then any punishment we can give will not equal the fate she will eventually suffer...
TEXT.Spanish: The testimony has been heard and a just decision has been made. Lita of Alexandria will be exiled from the Empire. This exile will be initiated by throwing her from the Cliffs of Hastur. Like the crow, Lita will take flight.[NEWLINE] If she falls to her death, she may be given an Order funeral. If not, then any punishment we can give will not equal the fate she will eventually suffer...

TEXT.English: In times like these, when even the gods derelict their duty, all you can trust are your kin and your blade.
TEXT.French: In times like these, when even the gods derelict their duty, all you can trust are your kin and your blade.
TEXT.German: In Zeiten wie den heutigen, da sogar die Götter ihre Pflichten nicht ernst nehmen, gibt es nur zwei Dinge, auf die man vertrauen kann: die eigenen Leute und die eigene Klinge.
TEXT.Italian: In times like these, when even the gods derelict their duty, all you can trust are your kin and your blade.
TEXT.Spanish: In times like these, when even the gods derelict their duty, all you can trust are your kin and your blade.

TEXT.English: It is said, 'the enemy of your enemy is your friend.' And he is, for as long as you both have the same enemy. You must prepare for what comes after the victory, when they turn on you.
TEXT.French: It is said, 'the enemy of your enemy is your friend.' And he is, for as long as you both have the same enemy. You must prepare for what comes after the victory, when they turn on you.
TEXT.German: Man sagt, 'der Feind deines Feindes sei dein Freund'. Und das ist er in der Tat, doch nur so lange, wie der gemeinsame Feind noch da ist. 'Wappne dich für die Zeit nach dem Sieg, denn manche Sieger werden zu Verlierern werden'.
TEXT.Italian: It is said, 'the enemy of your enemy is your friend.' And he is, for as long as you both have the same enemy. You must prepare for what comes after the victory, when they turn on you.
TEXT.Spanish: It is said, 'the enemy of your enemy is your friend.' And he is, for as long as you both have the same enemy. You must prepare for what comes after the victory, when they turn on you.

TEXT.English: Look, battles are easy. Humans want to complicate things, but all that you really have to do is shoot the enemy in the back. If you cannot get behind the enemy, bribe them to shoot one another in the backs for you.
TEXT.French: Look, battles are easy. Humans want to complicate things, but all that you really have to do is shoot the enemy in the back. If you cannot get behind the enemy, bribe them to shoot one another in the backs for you.
TEXT.German: Also, Schlachten sind einfach. Menschen sind kompliziert, doch alles, was man machen muss, ist ihnen in den Rücken zu schießen. Wenn man nicht hinter sie kommt, dann bestich sie, damit sie sich gegenseitig in den Rücken schießen. Denn Schlachten sind einfach, weil Menschen so kompliziert sind.
TEXT.Italian: Look, battles are easy. Humans want to complicate things, but all that you really have to do is shoot the enemy in the back. If you cannot get behind the enemy, bribe them to shoot one another in the backs for you.
TEXT.Spanish: Look, battles are easy. Humans want to complicate things, but all that you really have to do is shoot the enemy in the back. If you cannot get behind the enemy, bribe them to shoot one another in the backs for you.

TEXT.English: It looks a little like ash, does it not? Careful, my liege, with your candle. This powder, these fine grains on the table before you, this is the future of warfare. This powder, in sufficient quantities, will crush Walls and Wills in equal measure. And once those are out of the way, the rest is just mopping up.
TEXT.French: It looks a little like ash, does it not? Careful, my liege, with your candle. This powder, these fine grains on the table before you, this is the future of warfare. This powder, in sufficient quantities, will crush Walls and Wills in equal measure. And once those are out of the way, the rest is just mopping up.
TEXT.German: Es sieht doch nach Asche aus, oder nicht? Vorsichtig mit der Kerze bitte, mein Herr. Dieses Pulver aus diesen feinen Körnern vor Euch auf dem Tisch, das ist die Zukunft der Kriegsführung. Dieses Pulver, in ausreichenden Menge, wird Mauern und Wälle in gleichem Maße einstürzen lassen. Und wenn diese erstmal aus dem Weg geräumt sind, dann ist der Rest nur noch einfach Aufräumen und Putzen.
TEXT.Italian: It looks a little like ash, does it not? Careful, my liege, with your candle. This powder, these fine grains on the table before you, this is the future of warfare. This powder, in sufficient quantities, will crush Walls and Wills in equal measure. And once those are out of the way, the rest is just mopping up.
TEXT.Spanish: It looks a little like ash, does it not? Careful, my liege, with your candle. This powder, these fine grains on the table before you, this is the future of warfare. This powder, in sufficient quantities, will crush Walls and Wills in equal measure. And once those are out of the way, the rest is just mopping up.

TEXT.English: They march down our roads in brave, glorious columns. They have drilled their formations. Left turn. Right turn. I have spent a handful of minutes preparing magics which shall end all of those years of practice.
TEXT.French: They march down our roads in brave, glorious columns. They have drilled their formations. Left turn. Right turn. I have spent a handful of minutes preparing magics which shall end all of those years of practice.

TEXT.Spanish: They march down our roads in brave, glorious columns. They have drilled their formations. Left turn. Right turn. I have spent a handful of minutes preparing magics which shall end all of those years of practice.

TEXT.English: War is sweet to those who do not know it.
TEXT.French: La guerre est plaisante pour qui ne l'a jamais vécue.
TEXT.German: "Der Krieg schmeckt jenen süß, die ihn noch nicht gekostet haben".
TEXT.Italian: War is sweet to those who do not know it.
TEXT.Spanish: War is sweet to those who do not know it.

TEXT.English: Attack from the hills not across the river. Are you SURE you get the idea, Greeb? Yes, the arrows and walls WILL be a problem, Snod, but that's why we gave the Ogres big rocks. You say they ate the rocks, Harough? For Bhall's sake, just... CHARGE!
TEXT.French: Attack from the hills not across the river. Are you SURE you get the idea, Greeb? Yes, the arrows and walls WILL be a problem, Snod, but that's why we gave the Ogres big rocks. You say they ate the rocks, Harough? For Bhall's sake, just... CHARGE!
TEXT.German: Greift von Hügeln aus nicht über den Fluss an. Seid Ihr SICHER, dass Ihr das verstanden habt, Greeb? Richtig, die Pfeile und die Wälle sind ein Problem, Snod, aber das ist der Grund, warum wir den Trollen diese großen Felsen gegeben haben. Ihr sagt, sie haben die Felsen gegessen, Harough? Um Bhalls Willen, nun bloß... NACHLADEN!
TEXT.Italian: Attack from the hills not across the river. Are you SURE you get the idea, Greeb? Yes, the arrows and walls WILL be a problem, Snod, but that's why we gave the Ogres big rocks. You say they ate the rocks, Harough? For Bhall's sake, just... CHARGE!
TEXT.Spanish: Attack from the hills not across the river. Are you SURE you get the idea, Greeb? Yes, the arrows and walls WILL be a problem, Snod, but that's why we gave the Ogres big rocks. You say they ate the rocks, Harough? For Bhall's sake, just... CHARGE!

TEXT.English: "Objections to the use of the undead in warfare are founded in misguided tradition. The air chills notably in the presence of a Wraith, need you more proof of their suitability, look only to your sons and daughters who have been spared from battle by our Conjurer's minions.
TEXT.French: "Objections to the use of the undead in warfare are founded in misguided tradition. The air chills notably in the presence of a Wraith, need you more proof of their suitability, look only to your sons and daughters who have been spared from battle by our Conjurer's minions.

TEXT.English: Do you think I enjoy killing? Do you think I enjoy cutting down those begging for mercy? I do not. But I know I must, because for the followers of the Ashen Veil, giving mercy is a sign of weakness, a chance to stab you in the back when you turn away.
TEXT.French: Vous croyez que j'aime tuer ? Vous croyez que j'aime achever ceux qui implorent ma miséricorde ? C'est faux. Mais je sais que c'est nécessaire, car pour les disciples du Voile Cendré, faire preuve de pitié est un signe de faiblesse, une occasion de vous poignarder dès que vous aurez le dos tourné.
TEXT.German: Do you think I enjoy killing? Do you think I enjoy cutting down those begging for mercy? I do not. But I know I must, because for the followers of the Ashen Veil, giving mercy is a sign of weakness, a chance to stab you in the back when you turn away.
TEXT.Italian: Do you think I enjoy killing? Do you think I enjoy cutting down those begging for mercy? I do not. But I know I must, because for the followers of the Ashen Veil, giving mercy is a sign of weakness, a chance to stab you in the back when you turn away.
TEXT.Spanish: Do you think I enjoy killing? Do you think I enjoy cutting down those begging for mercy? I do not. But I know I must, because for the followers of the Ashen Veil, giving mercy is a sign of weakness, a chance to stab you in the back when you turn away.

TEXT.English: Drown our Warriors to make Zombies? It may be Militarily practical, but... why waste perfectly good food?
TEXT.French: Noyer nos guerriers pour en faire des zombies ? Ça pourrait être pratique militairement parlant. mais à quoi bon gâcher une si bonne nourriture ?
TEXT.German: Drown our Warriors to make Zombies? It may be Militarily practical, but... why waste perfectly good food?
TEXT.Italian: Drown our Warriors to make Zombies? It may be Militarily practical, but... why waste perfectly good food?
TEXT.Spanish: Drown our Warriors to make Zombies? It may be Militarily practical, but... why waste perfectly good food?

TEXT.English: What is best in life? To crush your enemies, see them driven before you, and to hear the lamentations of their women!
TEXT.French: Qu'y a-t-il de mieux dans la vie ? Écraser ses ennemis, les voir mourir devant soi et entendre les lamentations de leurs femmes !
TEXT.German: What is best in life? To crush your enemies, see them driven before you, and to hear the lamentations of their women!
TEXT.Italian: What is best in life? To crush your enemies, see them driven before you, and to hear the lamentations of their women!
TEXT.Spanish: What is best in life? To crush your enemies, see them driven before you, and to hear the lamentations of their women!

TEXT.English: You think I planned that?
TEXT.French: Vous pensez que c'était planifié ?
TEXT.German: "Denkt Ihr, ich hätte das GEPLANT?"
TEXT.Italian: You think I planned that?
TEXT.Spanish: You think I planned that?

TEXT.English: "I remember asking him why we were avoiding battle... why we were slaughtering the Bannor's sheep instead of their men. 'Because, my boy,' Nigel laughed, a merry glint in his eye, 'the sheep don't fight back!'"[NEWLINE]--Graehme Purvis, Reminisces of a Raider
TEXT.French: "I remember asking him why we were avoiding battle... why we were slaughtering the Bannor's sheep instead of their men. 'Because, my boy,' Nigel laughed, a merry glint in his eye, 'the sheep don't fight back!'"[NEWLINE]--Graehme Purvis, Reminisces of a Raider

TEXT.English: Fire is my Muse. The Catapult my instrument. Men tremble at my Ballads.
TEXT.French: Le Feu est ma muse, la catapulte mon instrument. Les Hommes tremblent face à mes ballades.
TEXT.German: Feuer ist meine Muse. Das Katapult mein Instrument. Männer erzittern bei meinen Balladen.
TEXT.Italian: Fire is my Muse. The Catapult my instrument. Men tremble at my Ballads.
TEXT.Spanish: Fire is my Muse. The Catapult my instrument. Men tremble at my Ballads.

TEXT.English: "Did you consider the impact our magic would have on the battle? What would happen if the air and earth turned against you? If half of your well-trained soldiers suddenly stopped attacking in the midst of battle? If our soldiers' weapons cleaved through iron and steel like air? No? Hmph... I did!
TEXT.French: "Did you consider the impact our magic would have on the battle? What would happen if the air and earth turned against you? If half of your well-trained soldiers suddenly stopped attacking in the midst of battle? If our soldiers' weapons cleaved through iron and steel like air? No? Hmph... I did!

TEXT.English: This "Mithril" has many possible uses. You could shape it into a sword, and trade it to a merchant for gold. Or, you could kill the merchant with it and have both the sword and the gold. Both are fine decisions.

TEXT.English: Long has the glory of the Heavens caught Man's eye. It is my humble task to see the favor returned.

TEXT.English: They laughed when I started digging they did. But who is laughing now? Who is the one who discovered the Great Iron Vein? Who created the Mines of Gal-Dur? Ha! That's right! ME!
TEXT.French: They laughed when I started digging they did. But who is laughing now? Who is the one who discovered the Great Iron Vein? Who created the Mines of Gal-Dur? Ha! That's right! ME!

TEXT.English: "Then the light caught on the the carving, and a coldness lanced through me that had nothing to do with the cool air. The figures were not carved into the ice blocks of the wall. Rather, the figures were people, frozen corpses embedded into the walls as a testament to the wrath of the Lord of Winter."[NEWLINE]--Account from the taking of Garduk

TEXT.English: I planned these cities. With the help of a thousand peoples I built them. Look at them! Are they not the grandest things on Erebus? Home to unimaginable numbers, reaching up to heaven, all shining like the gold they're made of. See them gleam!

TEXT.Italian: I planned these cities. With the help of a thousand peoples I built them. Look at them! Are they not the grandest things on Erebus? Home to unimaginable numbers, reaching up to heaven, all shining like the gold they're made of. See them gleam!
TEXT.Spanish: I planned these cities. With the help of a thousand peoples I built them. Look at them! Are they not the grandest things on Erebus? Home to unimaginable numbers, reaching up to heaven, all shining like the gold they're made of. See them gleam!

TEXT.English: I have discovered the process corrupting our spell. Observe... Notice that there's no divinatory component validating the birthsign of target. That's a problem. Targets born under the Null Star will still be affected by the magic. Yet the resulting demons will just walk away and are soon out of the target's range. This corrupts the whole summoning and, as the caster closes the portal, the demon returns and the caster dies a horrible death."
TEXT.French: I have discovered the process corrupting our spell. Observe... Notice that there's no divinatory component validating the birthsign of target. That's a problem. TEXT.English: Arthur had Morgan Tud, chief physician, called to him. "Take with thee Edeyrn, the son of Nudd, and cause a chamber to be prepared for him, and let him have the aid of medicine as thou wouldst do unto myself were I wounded."
TEXT.French: Arthur had Morgan Tud, chief physician, called to him. "Take with thee Edeyrn, the son of Nudd, and cause a chamber to be prepared for him, and let him have the aid of medicine as thou wouldst do unto myself were I wounded."

TEXT.English: The effectiveness of the treatment is related to the doctor's thoughts and mind intent. It is very subtle. A doctor needs to skillfully adjust the acupuncture to accommodate each patient's blood circulation. A tiny deviation from the required acupuncture can cause severe consequences.
TEXT.French: L'efficacité d'un traitement est assujettie aux pensées et intentions du docteur. C'est très subtil. Un docteur doit ajuster finement l'acupuncture pour s'adapter à la circulation sanguine de chaque patient. Toute déviation, aussi minime soit-elle, peut avoir de sévères répercussions.
TEXT.German: The effectiveness of the treatment is related to the doctor's thoughts and mind intent. It is very subtle. A doctor needs to skillfully adjust the acupuncture to accommodate each patient's blood circulation. A tiny deviation from the required acupuncture can cause severe consequences.
TEXT.Italian: The effectiveness of the treatment is related to the doctor's thoughts and mind intent. It is very subtle. A doctor needs to skillfully adjust the acupuncture to accommodate each patient's blood circulation. A tiny deviation from the required acupuncture can cause severe consequences.
TEXT.Spanish: The effectiveness of the treatment is related to the doctor's thoughts and mind intent. It is very subtle. A doctor needs to skillfully adjust the acupuncture to accommodate each patient's blood circulation. A tiny deviation from the required acupuncture can cause severe consequences.

TEXT.English: The stranger entered the room and the group saw at once that he was quite strange. His suit was made from every color of the rainbow and so was his hat. He was tall and thin and had bright, piercing eyes.[NEWLINE]"I'm called the Pied Piper," said the stranger. "Tell me, gentlemen, what would you pay me if I could get rid of every single rat in town?"
TEXT.French: Il commença à jouer un air étrange, et tel que jamais flûteur n'en a joué. Voilà qu'en entendant cet air, de tous les greniers, de tous les trous de murs, de dessous les chevrons et les tuiles des toits, rats et souris, par centaines, par milliers, accoururent à lui. L'étranger, toujours flûtant, s'achemina vers le fleuve ; et là, ayant tiré ses chausses, il entra dans l'eau suivi de tous les rats, qui furent aussitôt noyés.
TEXT.German: The stranger entered the room and the group saw at once that he was quite strange. His suit was made from every color of the rainbow and so was his hat. He was tall and thin and had bright, piercing eyes.[NEWLINE]"I'm called the Pied Piper," said the stranger. "Tell me, gentlemen, what would you pay me if I could get rid of every single rat in town?"
TEXT.Italian: The stranger entered the room and the group saw at once that he was quite strange. His suit was made from every color of the rainbow and so was his hat. He was tall and thin and had bright, piercing eyes.[NEWLINE]"I'm called the Pied Piper," said the stranger. "Tell me, gentlemen, what would you pay me if I could get rid of every single rat in town?"
TEXT.Spanish: The stranger entered the room and the group saw at once that he was quite strange. His suit was made from every color of the rainbow and so was his hat. He was tall and thin and had bright, piercing eyes.[NEWLINE]"I'm called the Pied Piper," said the stranger. "Tell me, gentlemen, what would you pay me if I could get rid of every single rat in town?"

TEXT.English: Fat is life!
TEXT.French: Le gras, c'est la vie !
TEXT.German: Fat is life!
TEXT.Italian: Fat is life!
TEXT.Spanish: Fat is life!

TEXT.English: Soak the bandages in this, apply twice daily. It'll heal everything, save regret, which is beyond my power. For the moment, at least.
TEXT.French: Imbibez les bandages avec ceci, et renouvellez deux fois par jour. Ça soignera tout, sauf le regret, qui est au-delà de mes compétences. Du moins pour le moment.
TEXT.German: Soak the bandages in this, apply twice daily. It'll heal everything, save regret, which is beyond my power. For the moment, at least.
TEXT.Italian: Soak the bandages in this, apply twice daily. It'll heal everything, save regret, which is beyond my power. For the moment, at least.
TEXT.Spanish: Soak the bandages in this, apply twice daily. It'll heal everything, save regret, which is beyond my power. For the moment, at least.

TEXT.English: Yes, it hurts. Scream if you have to, curse and rage and hate me - you have as long as you like to do so, because thanks to me, you're going to LIVE.
TEXT.French: Oui, c'est douloureux. Hurlez s'il le faut, maudissez-moi, détestez-moi. Vous allez pouvoir continuer longtemps comme ça, parce que grâce à moi, vous allez VIVRE !
TEXT.German: Yes, it hurts. Scream if you have to, curse and rage and hate me - you have as long as you like to do so, because thanks to me, you're going to LIVE.
TEXT.Italian: Yes, it hurts. Scream if you have to, curse and rage and hate me - you have as long as you like to do so, because thanks to me, you're going to LIVE.
TEXT.Spanish: Yes, it hurts. Scream if you have to, curse and rage and hate me - you have as long as you like to do so, because thanks to me, you're going to LIVE.

TEXT.English: Hush, sister. It doesn't matter who you were, or are, or are going to be. I don't care what paths you tread, save one - the path to recovery. Now, be still.
TEXT.French: Silence, ma sœur. Peu importe qui vous étiez, qui vous êtes ou qui serez. Je ne suis aucunement intéressé par votre parcours, sauf s'il s'agit de celui qui vous amène à la guérison. Alors tenez-vous tranquille.
TEXT.German: Hush, sister. It doesn't matter who you were, or are, or are going to be. I don't care what paths you tread, save one - the path to recovery. Now, be still.
TEXT.Italian: Hush, sister. It doesn't matter who you were, or are, or are going to be. I don't care what paths you tread, save one - the path to recovery. Now, be still.
TEXT.Spanish: Hush, sister. It doesn't matter who you were, or are, or are going to be. I don't care what paths you tread, save one - the path to recovery. Now, be still.

TEXT.English: Where the first Horseman treads, pestilence follows. But it does not depart with him. Lucky for you, neither do I.
TEXT.French: Là où le Premier Cavalier passe, la pestilence suit. Mais elle ne repart pas avec lui. Heureusement pour vous, moi non plus.
TEXT.German: Where the first Horseman treads, pestilence follows. But it does not depart with him. Lucky for you, neither do I.
TEXT.Italian: Where the first Horseman treads, pestilence follows. But it does not depart with him. Lucky for you, neither do I.
TEXT.Spanish: Where the first Horseman treads, pestilence follows. But it does not depart with him. Lucky for you, neither do I.

TEXT.English: The needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few - did you know that? Unfortunately, your infection is... unique. I'll need to study the symptoms.[NEWLINE]I'm so sorry.
TEXT.French: Les besoins du plus grand nombre l'emportent sur les nécessités du plus petit. Vous étiez au courant ? Malheureusement, votre infection est... unique. Je vais être obligée d'étudier les symptômes[NEWLINE]Vous m'en voyez navrée.
TEXT.German: The needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few - did you know that? Unfortunately, your infection is... unique. I'll need to study the symptoms.[NEWLINE]I'm so sorry.
TEXT.Italian: The needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few - did you know that? Unfortunately, your infection is... unique. I'll need to study the symptoms.[NEWLINE]I'm so sorry.
TEXT.Spanish: The needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few - did you know that? Unfortunately, your infection is... unique. I'll need to study the symptoms.[NEWLINE]I'm so sorry.

TEXT.English: Get me hot compresses, six clean needles, a gallon of wine and access to an apothecary, and I will give you long life free of pain. Get me two hours alone in the tomb of the God of Life, and I will give you immortality.
TEXT.French: Fournissez-moi des compresses chaudes, 6 aiguilles stériles, une cruche de vin ainsi que l'accès à une apothicairerie, et je vous offrirai une vie longue et indolore. Laissez-moi seul 2 heures dans le tombeau du Dieu de la Vie, et je vous offrirai l'immortalité.
TEXT.German: Get me hot compresses, six clean needles, a gallon of wine and access to an apothecary, and I will give you long life free of pain. Get me two hours alone in the tomb of the God of Life, and I will give you immortality.
TEXT.Italian: Get me hot compresses, six clean needles, a gallon of wine and access to an apothecary, and I will give you long life free of pain. Get me two hours alone in the tomb of the God of Life, and I will give you immortality.
TEXT.Spanish: Get me hot compresses, six clean needles, a gallon of wine and access to an apothecary, and I will give you long life free of pain. Get me two hours alone in the tomb of the God of Life, and I will give you immortality.

TEXT.English: Iram sent forth his student as an assassin in dire circumstance, and until terrible duress. But Zil had learned too much to betray him - even at his request.[NEWLINE]-From "A Flower Blooms in Osterek", a biography
TEXT.French: Iram envoya son étudiant en mission d'assassinat dans de terribles circonstances, et sous la contrainte. Mais Zil avait trop appris de lui pour le trahir, même à sa demande.[NEWLINE]-Tiré de « Une fleur éclot à Osterek », une biographie
TEXT.German: Iram sent forth his student as an assassin in dire circumstance, and until terrible duress. But Zil had learned too much to betray him - even at his request.[NEWLINE]-From "A Flower Blooms in Osterek", a biography
