TEXT.English: I worship only one of the gods. And his name is Death. And there is only one thing that I say to Death: Not today!
TEXT.French: Je vénère un seul Dieu. Et son nom est Mort. Et à la Mort, je ne dis qu'une chose : Pas aujourd'hui !
TEXT.German: Ich bete nur zu einem einzigen der Götter. Und sein Name ist Tod. Und es gibt nur eines, was ich zum Tod sage: Nicht heute!
TEXT.Italian: I worship only in one god. And his name is Death. And there is only one thing that I say to Death: Not today!
TEXT.Spanish: I worship only in one god. And his name is Death. And there is only one thing that I say to Death: Not today!

TEXT.English: I told him, "There will be a great deal of pain. You are human. Don't be afraid; be brave."[NEWLINE]He asked, "Can a man still be brave if he's afraid?"[NEWLINE]And when he started screaming, I replied, "That is the only time a man can be brave."
TEXT.French: Je lui ai dit « Tu vas beaucoup souffrir. Tu es humain. Ne sois pas effrayé, sois courageux. »[NEWLINE]Il a demandé : « Un homme peut-il être courageux s'il est effrayé ? »[NEWLINE]Quand il a commencé à hurler, je lui ai répondu : « C'est le seul moment où un homme peut être courageux »
TEXT.German: Ich sprach zu ihm: Der Schmerz wird unerträglich sein. Du bist ein Mensch. Fürchte dich nicht, sei tapfer. Er fragte: Kann man tapfer sein, wenn man Angst hat? Und während er zu schreien anfing, entgegnete ich: Das ist der einzige Moment, in dem man tapfer sein kann.
TEXT.Italian: I told him, "There will be a great deal of pain. You are human. Don't be afraid; be brave."[NEWLINE]He asked, "Can a man still be brave if he's afraid?"[NEWLINE]And when he started screaming, I replied, "That is the only time a man can be brave."
TEXT.Spanish: I told him, "There will be a great deal of pain. You are human. Don't be afraid; be brave."[NEWLINE]He asked, "Can a man still be brave if he's afraid?"[NEWLINE]And when he started screaming, I replied, "That is the only time a man can be brave."

TEXT.English: Unfortunately, our divinations prove that the vein of silver is directly beneath the slums of Ithaca. But with your permission, m'lord Kylorin, we can solve both this problem and the lack of available slaves with a single stroke...

TEXT.English: I never called them anything other than 'meat pies.' So I wasn't technically lying. Besides, the city morgues were getting too full, the poor were going hungry... See a Need, fill a Need.

TEXT.English: Gold was my servant, not my master[NEWLINE]--Epitaph
TEXT.French: L'or était mon serviteur, pas mon maître[NEWLINE]--Épitaphe
TEXT.German: Gold war mein Diener, nicht mein Meister[NEWLINE]--Epitaph
TEXT.Italian: Gold was my servant, not my master[NEWLINE]--Epitaph
TEXT.Spanish: Gold was my servant, not my master[NEWLINE]--Epitaph

TEXT.English: Men are always after what is best for themselves or their friends. They think only of the "now." It falls to Women, the bearers of our future, to make sacrifices to ensure the best for our children.
TEXT.French: Les hommes sont toujours en recherche du mieux, pour eux ou pour leurs amis. Ils ne pensent qu'au présent. Il incombe aux femmes, détentrices de notre avenir, de faire les sacrifices nécessaires à la prospérité de nos enfants.
TEXT.German: Men are always after what is best for themselves or their friends. They think only of the "now." It falls to Women, the bearers of our future, to make sacrifices to ensure the best for our children.
TEXT.Italian: Men are always after what is best for themselves or their friends. They think only of the "now." It falls to Women, the bearers of our future, to make sacrifices to ensure the best for our children.
TEXT.Spanish: Men are always after what is best for themselves or their friends. They think only of the "now." It falls to Women, the bearers of our future, to make sacrifices to ensure the best for our children.

TEXT.English: The Bannor say they believe that human slavery is a sinful abomination, but I call hypocrisy. They use their own people as mere pawns in their hopeless war against the Sheiam-- those they conquer are slaves in all but name, working and fighting only to avoid the headsman's axe. Me, I'm just more honest in my nomenclature.
TEXT.French: The Bannor say they believe that human slavery is a sinful abomination, but I call hypocrisy. They use their own people as mere pawns in their hopeless war against the Sheiam-- those they conquer are slaves in all but name, working and fighting only to avoid the headsman's axe. Me, I'm just more honest in my nomenclature.

TEXT.English: I may be less an eye and a hand, but at least we've all learned a valuable lesson.[NEWLINE]--Captain's log #1978
TEXT.French: J'y ai peut-être perdu un œil et une main, mais au moins, nous avons tous appris une leçon importante.[NEWLINE]-- Journal du Capitaine #1978

TEXT.English: Meeting foreigners is always tricky; I introduce myself as "Maaerun, human trader." And then they say that I'm obviously not human, and I have to say, "Well, that's not exactly what I meant."
TEXT.French: Meeting foreigners is always tricky; I introduce myself as "Maaerun, human trader." And then they say that I'm obviously not human, and I have to say, "Well, that's not exactly what I meant."

TEXT.English: My endeavors earn me a golden treasure, yet I am poor. Because I am as a river to my people.
TEXT.French: My endeavors earn me a golden treasure, yet I am poor. Because I am as a river to my people.

TEXT.Spanish: My endeavors earn me a golden treasure, yet I am poor. Because I am as a river to my people.

TEXT.English: I have turned my back on my people and my god. The religion that once seemed so important to me, that I dedicated my life to, offered no comfort to me when I needed it. Only hollow words about faith and my own weakness.
TEXT.French: I have turned my back on my people and my god. The religion that once seemed so important to me, that I dedicated my life to, offered no comfort to me when I needed it. Only hollow words about faith and my own weakness.

TEXT.English: Any decent merchant knows the price of something, but few know the value of it.
TEXT.French: Any decent merchant knows the price of something, but few know the value of it.
TEXT.German: Any decent merchant knows the price of something, but few know the value of it.

TEXT.Spanish: Any decent merchant knows the price of something, but few know the value of it.

TEXT.English: The most exquisite and pure glass you've ever seen, at least until it melts in your bags on the way out of Garduk. I suppose it's a good thing that most of my customers freeze to death, I'd hate to disappoint them.
TEXT.French: The most exquisite and pure glass you've ever seen, at least until it melts in your bags on the way out of Garduk. I suppose it's a good thing that most of my customers freeze to death, I'd hate to disappoint them.

TEXT.English: Why do you praise Junil for the bread? Did He sow the seed? Did He reap the harvest? Did He bake the bread? The farmer grows the wheat, is he Junil? The miller makes the flour, is he Junil? The baker bakes the bread, is he Junil? Place praise where praise belongs, for without the farmer, miller and baker you would starve, but Junil brings you nothing good you couldn't get otherwise. Indeed, without you doing His will He would be nothing.
TEXT.French: Why do you praise Junil for the bread? Did He sow the seed? Did He reap the harvest? Did He bake the bread? The farmer grows the wheat, is he Junil? The miller makes the flour, is he Junil? The baker bakes the bread, is he Junil? Place praise where praise belongs, for without the farmer, miller and baker you would starve, but Junil brings you nothing good you couldn't get otherwise. Indeed, without you doing His will He would be nothing.

TEXT.English: They say I'm rich in my gold and I don't have anything else. They are wrong. I'm rich in my children, in the deeds I've done, in the things I created. In gold, I'm filthy rich!
TEXT.French: They say I'm rich in my gold and I don't have anything else. They are wrong. I'm rich in my children, in the deeds I've done, in the things I created. In gold, I'm filthy rich!

TEXT.English: Admittedly, my methods have been criticized as being murderous, wasteful and borderline demonic, but I take exception to this; I have never been wasteful.
TEXT.French: Admittedly, my methods have been criticized as being murderous, wasteful and borderline demonic, but I take exception to this; I have never been wasteful.

TEXT.Spanish: Admittedly, my methods have been criticized as being murderous, wasteful and borderline demonic, but I take exception to this; I have never been wasteful.

TEXT.English: If someone offends me, some gold in the right hands will take them out of my life. If I or one of my family fall ill, I can buy medicine. You may think there is power in swords and prayer, but I find my power in Gold.
TEXT.French: If someone offends me, some gold in the right hands will take them out of my life. If I or one of my family fall ill, I can buy medicine. You may think there is power in swords and prayer, but I find my power in Gold.

TEXT.English: A fool and his money are lucky enough to get together in the first place
TEXT.French: A fool and his money are lucky enough to get together in the first place
TEXT.German: A fool and his money are lucky enough to get together in the first place
TEXT.Italian: A fool and his money are lucky enough to get together in the first place
TEXT.Spanish: A fool and his money are lucky enough to get together in the first place

TEXT.English: Even the intelligent man and his wealth shall part ways. The fool however, will miss the wealth so much that he believes any lie that offers the hope to have it again.
TEXT.French: Même l'Intelligent et sa richesse prendront des chemins séparés. L'Idiot, par contre, regrettera tellement sa richesse perdue qu'il croira n'importe quel mensonge qui lui offre l'espoir de la retrouver.
TEXT.German: Even the intelligent man and his wealth shall part ways. The fool however, will miss the wealth so much that he believes any lie that offers the hope to have it again.

TEXT.English: Sometimes the best bargaining chip is the one you put in somebody's skull.
TEXT.French: Sometimes the best bargaining chip is the one you put in somebody's skull.
TEXT.German: Sometimes the best bargaining chip is the one you put in somebody's skull.
TEXT.Italian: Sometimes the best bargaining chip is the one you put in somebody's skull.
TEXT.Spanish: Sometimes the best bargaining chip is the one you put in somebody's skull.

TEXT.English: Establishing the structure of Bannor will not only make that people happy, but will have some effect in diminishing the misery of those, who in other parts of the world, groan under despotism.
TEXT.French: Establishing the structure of Bannor will not only make that people happy, but will have some effect in diminishing the misery of those, who in other parts of the world, groan under despotism.
TEXT.German: Establishing the structure of Bannor will not only make that people happy, but will have some effect in diminishing the misery of those, who in other parts of the world, groan under despotism.

TEXT.Spanish: Establishing the structure of Bannor will not only make that people happy, but will have some effect in diminishing the misery of those, who in other parts of the world, groan under despotism.

TEXT.English: We are the heirs of the ages, and yet we have had to pay few of the penalties in which old countries are exacted by the dead hand of a bygone civilization
TEXT.French: We are the heirs of the ages, and yet we have had to pay few of the penalties in which old countries are exacted by the dead hand of a bygone civilization

TEXT.English: A man seek only average wisdom, for a man's heart is seldom cheerful if he is too wise.
TEXT.French: A man seek only average wisdom, for a man's heart is seldom cheerful if he is too wise.
TEXT.German: A man seek only average wisdom, for a man's heart is seldom cheerful if he is too wise.
TEXT.Italian: A man seek only average wisdom, for a man's heart is seldom cheerful if he is too wise.
TEXT.Spanish: A man seek only average wisdom, for a man's heart is seldom cheerful if he is too wise.

TEXT.English: The night shall be thy cloak, and thou shalt blend with it as doth the darkest panther. Deception shall be thy blade, and mystery thy follower. Turn back from no place, but become as one with the inhabitants there, till their will is thine, or their blood the earth's.
TEXT.French: The night shall be thy cloak, and thou shalt blend with it as doth the darkest panther. Deception shall be thy blade, and mystery thy follower. Turn back from no place, but become as one with the inhabitants there, till their will is thine, or their blood the earth's.

TEXT.English: Comes the dragon, comes his magnificence, comes the brightest gold the world has seen. What part have we in mysterious magics? We shall be but trampled underfoot coming and going by one god or another. But come with me, and ride with the dragon, and he with fire and acid shall guard our glory and destroy the hordes that rise up against it. The dragon is power. Soon we shall have among us the essence of the divine.

TEXT.English: As with The Order, the worst advertisement for the Bannor are its fanatics.
TEXT.French: De même que pour l'Ordre, les fanatiques sont la pire publicité des Bannor.
TEXT.German: As with The Order, the worst advertisement for the Bannor are its fanatics.
TEXT.Italian: As with The Order, the worst advertisement for the Bannor are its fanatics.
TEXT.Spanish: As with The Order, the worst advertisement for the Bannor are its fanatics.

TEXT.English: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before false gods. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.
TEXT.French: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before false gods. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.
TEXT.German: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before false gods. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.
TEXT.Italian: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before false gods. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.
TEXT.Spanish: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before false gods. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.

TEXT.English: They refer to us as "lunatics" only because they understand neither the meaning nor the ultimate purpose behind our Speaker's visions. But then, what can you expect of a people who have never dreamed of the towers of Carcosa, or midwifed the birth of a Drown?
TEXT.French: They refer to us as "lunatics" only because they understand neither the meaning nor the ultimate purpose behind our Speaker's visions. But then, what can you expect of a people who have never dreamed of the towers of Carcosa, or midwifed the birth of a Drown?

TEXT.English: "Nature, while inventive, lacks true imagination in this regard, but to an... Unencumbered mind, the possibilities are intriguing. A tigers teeth give a last ditch weapon, a hawk's eyes enhance an archer, and a bear's strength and fur could give any soldier an advantage over the northern savages. Furthermore, with the proper supplication to our masters, the problem of unwilling subjects is easily overcome..."[NEWLINE]-- From Speaker Nyarlat Hotep's Musings on Perfection

TEXT.English: The highest calling of any race is that of Industry, of taking raw materials from the world around us and shaping them into things of utility and beauty. This is the price of Kilmorph's blessing, and we pay it gladly.
TEXT.French: The highest calling of any race is that of Industry, of taking raw materials from the world around us and shaping them into things of utility and beauty. This is the price of Kilmorph's blessing, and we pay it gladly.

TEXT.English: Of all that is written I love only that which hath been written with Blood. Write with Blood and though wilt find that Blood is Spirit.
TEXT.French: Of all that is written I love only that which hath been written with Blood. Write with Blood and though wilt find that Blood is Spirit.
TEXT.German: Of all that is written I love only that which hath been written with Blood. Write with Blood and though wilt find that Blood is Spirit.

TEXT.Spanish: Of all that is written I love only that which hath been written with Blood. Write with Blood and though wilt find that Blood is Spirit.

TEXT.English: No one ever really pays for it in silver. The price of any evil -- necessary or otherwise -- comes due in flesh.
TEXT.French: No one ever really pays for it in silver. The price of any evil -- necessary or otherwise -- comes due in flesh.
TEXT.German: No one ever really pays for it in silver. The price of any evil -- necessary or otherwise -- comes due in flesh.
TEXT.Italian: No one ever really pays for it in silver. The price of any evil -- necessary or otherwise -- comes due in flesh.
TEXT.Spanish: No one ever really pays for it in silver. The price of any evil -- necessary or otherwise -- comes due in flesh.

TEXT.English: We have always been animals first and people second, so that no matter how eloquently our reason may speak, the final word is always had by our hunger, our rage, our lust.
TEXT.French: We have always been animals first and people second, so that no matter how eloquently our reason may speak, the final word is always had by our hunger, our rage, our lust.
TEXT.German: We have always been animals first and people second, so that no matter how eloquently our reason may speak, the final word is always had by our hunger, our rage, our lust.
TEXT.Italian: We have always been animals first and people second, so that no matter how eloquently our reason may speak, the final word is always had by our hunger, our rage, our lust.
TEXT.Spanish: We have always been animals first and people second, so that no matter how eloquently our reason may speak, the final word is always had by our hunger, our rage, our lust.

TEXT.English: What are the names of these demons you say I follow?" Lita argued, "Hate, suspicion, fear, weakness, pride. Do you believe these are my demons or your own? You scream because I killed a bird, yet you will return to your mutton dinner tonight and see no hypocrisy. You claim that what I have done is evil, yet the temple diviners perform the same acts with oils and burnt incense.
TEXT.French: « Quels sont les noms de ces démons dont vous me prétendez la servante ? » argumenta Lita. « Haine, suspicion, peur, faiblesse, orgueil. Croyez-vous que ce sont mes démons ou plutôt les vôtres ? Vous m'invectivez parce que j'ai tué un oiseau, alors que vous allez dîner chez vous d'un mouton sans y voir la moindre hypocrisie. Vous affirmez que mes actes sont maléfiques, et pourtant, les devins du temple agissent de même avec des huiles et de l'encens.
TEXT.German: What are the names of these demons you say I follow?" Lita argued, "Hate, suspicion, fear, weakness, pride. Do you believe these are my demons or your own? You scream because I killed a bird, yet you will return to your mutton dinner tonight and see no hypocrisy. You claim that what I have done is evil, yet the temple diviners perform the same acts with oils and burnt incense.
TEXT.Italian: What are the names of these demons you say I follow?" Lita argued, "Hate, suspicion, fear, weakness, pride. Do you believe these are my demons or your own? You scream because I killed a bird, yet you will return to your mutton dinner tonight and see no hypocrisy. You claim that what I have done is evil, yet the temple diviners perform the same acts with oils and burnt incense.
TEXT.Spanish: What are the names of these demons you say I follow?" Lita argued, "Hate, suspicion, fear, weakness, pride. Do you believe these are my demons or your own? You scream because I killed a bird, yet you will return to your mutton dinner tonight and see no hypocrisy. You claim that what I have done is evil, yet the temple diviners perform the same acts with oils and burnt incense.

TEXT.English: Whenever I despair, I remember that the way of truth and love has always won. There may be tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they may seem invincible, but in the end, they always fail. Think of it: always.
TEXT.French: Whenever I despair, I remember that the way of truth and love has always won. There may be tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they may seem invincible, but in the end, they always fail. Think of it: always.

TEXT.English: Entropy always wins out in the end. Buildings decay, kingdoms collapse, and people die. Your life is just a long, futile struggle against the inevitability of time. Don't you think it's time you joined the winning side?
TEXT.French: L'entropie finit toujours par l'emporter. Les bâtiments se désagègent, les royaumes s'effondrent et les gens meurent. Votre vie n'est qu'une longue et futile bataille contre l'inéluctabilité du temps qui passe. Ne croyez-vous pas qu'il est temps de rejoindre le camp des gagnants ?
TEXT.German: Entropy always wins out in the end. Buildings decay, kingdoms collapse, and people die. Your life is just a long, futile struggle against the inevitability of time. Don't you think it's time you joined the winning side?
TEXT.Italian: Entropy always wins out in the end. Buildings decay, kingdoms collapse, and people die. Your life is just a long, futile struggle against the inevitability of time. Don't you think it's time you joined the winning side?
TEXT.Spanish: Entropy always wins out in the end. Buildings decay, kingdoms collapse, and people die. Your life is just a long, futile struggle against the inevitability of time. Don't you think it's time you joined the winning side?

TEXT.English: Dance. A walk through life. Dance. A tool in strife. Dance. Control your fate. Dance. The Overlords wait.
TEXT.French: Dance. A walk through life. Dance. A tool in strife. Dance. Control your fate. Dance. The Overlords wait.
TEXT.German: Dance. A walk through life. Dance. A tool in strife. Dance. Control your fate. Dance. The Overlords wait.
TEXT.Italian: Dance. A walk through life. Dance. A tool in strife. Dance. Control your fate. Dance. The Overlords wait.
TEXT.Spanish: Dance. A walk through life. Dance. A tool in strife. Dance. Control your fate. Dance. The Overlords wait.

TEXT.English: We will torture your body, break your bones, perhaps we'll kill your family, and toy with their rotten corpses. In time...
TEXT.French: We will torture your body, break your bones, perhaps we'll kill your family, and toy with their rotten corpses. In time...
TEXT.German: We will torture your body, break your bones, perhaps we'll kill your family, and toy with their rotten corpses. In time...

TEXT.English: The Veil will bring corruption from hell to the world! The must be opposed at every opportunity, for the sake of the world!
TEXT.French: The Veil will bring corruption from hell to the world! The must be opposed at every opportunity, for the sake of the world!
TEXT.German: The Veil will bring corruption from hell to the world! The must be opposed at every opportunity, for the sake of the world!
TEXT.Italian: The Veil will bring corruption from hell to the world! The must be opposed at every opportunity, for the sake of the world!
TEXT.Spanish: The Veil will bring corruption from hell to the world! The must be opposed at every opportunity, for the sake of the world!

TEXT.English: What most mortals fail to understand is that we do not come simply to kill. Your orcs and barbarians derive pleasure from killing. We are more... sophisticated. It is not mere death that we seek, but suffering. Madness. Torment. When Brother murders Brother and Daughter slays Mother, and Reason dissolves in the face of unutterable Chaos, that is when we shall rejoice, dancing to the piping of accursed flutes as your world burns around you."[NEWLINE]-- The demon-prophet Fand, just after the signing of the Infernal Pact
TEXT.French: What most mortals fail to understand is that we do not come simply to kill. Your orcs and barbarians derive pleasure from killing. We are more... sophisticated. It is not mere death that we seek, but suffering. Madness. Torment. TEXT.English: We have walked for this path for too long and everything else faded away. We have to continue in wicked deeds, blaspheme and deny the will of Heaven, or we would have to deny ourselves.
TEXT.French: We have walked for this path for too long and everything else faded away. We have to continue in wicked deeds, blaspheme and deny the will of Heaven, or we would have to deny ourselves.

TEXT.English: Aim at heaven and you will get earth thrown in. Aim at earth and you get neither.
TEXT.French: Aim at heaven and you will get earth thrown in. Aim at earth and you get neither.
TEXT.German: Aim at heaven and you will get earth thrown in. Aim at earth and you get neither.
TEXT.Italian: Aim at heaven and you will get earth thrown in. Aim at earth and you get neither.
TEXT.Spanish: Aim at heaven and you will get earth thrown in. Aim at earth and you get neither.

TEXT.English: Kylorin taught me that, given enough mana and skill with the flame, everything burns-- wood, steel, even rock. Therein lies the solution to most problems a mage might encounter during his career.
TEXT.French: Kylorin taught me that, given enough mana and skill with the flame, everything burns-- wood, steel, even rock. Therein lies the solution to most problems a mage might encounter during his career.
TEXT.German: Kylorin taught me that, given enough mana and skill with the flame, everything burns-- wood, steel, even rock. Therein lies the solution to most problems a mage might encounter during his career.

TEXT.Spanish: Kylorin taught me that, given enough mana and skill with the flame, everything burns-- wood, steel, even rock. Therein lies the solution to most problems a mage might encounter during his career.

TEXT.English: It is not the job of poison to murder any more than it is the job of the arrow to slay. My trade may be called criminal by some today, but it shall be called progress by all tomorrow.
TEXT.French: Le poison n'a pas plus vocation à assassiner que la flèche à occire. Aujourd'hui, mon expertise est qualifiée de criminelle par certains, mais demain, tous l'appelleront Progrès.
TEXT.German: It is not the job of poison to murder any more than it is the job of the arrow to slay. My trade may be called criminal by some today, but it shall be called progress by all tomorrow.
TEXT.Italian: It is not the job of poison to murder any more than it is the job of the arrow to slay. My trade may be called criminal by some today, but it shall be called progress by all tomorrow.
TEXT.Spanish: It is not the job of poison to murder any more than it is the job of the arrow to slay. My trade may be called criminal by some today, but it shall be called progress by all tomorrow.

TEXT.English: The only thing that's yet to yield is my thirst for knowledge.
TEXT.French: La seule chose qui subsiste encore est ma soif de connaissances.
TEXT.German: The only thing that's yet to yield is my thirst for knowledge.
TEXT.Italian: The only thing that's yet to yield is my thirst for knowledge.
TEXT.Spanish: The only thing that's yet to yield is my thirst for knowledge.

TEXT.English: I fear not the ether! I tame it! Mold it! Nurture it! I advance the cause to save Erebus from stagnation!
TEXT.French: Je ne crains pas l'éther ! Je l'apprivoise ! Je le façonne ! Je le fortifie ! J'avance la cause pour sauver Erebus de la stagnation !
TEXT.German: I fear not the ether! I tame it! Mold it! Nurture it! I advance the cause to save Erebus from stagnation!
TEXT.Italian: I fear not the ether! I tame it! Mold it! Nurture it! I advance the cause to save Erebus from stagnation!
TEXT.Spanish: I fear not the ether! I tame it! Mold it! Nurture it! I advance the cause to save Erebus from stagnation!

TEXT.English: Imagine a world where everything changes to match the state of your mind, where evidence never pushes back against your theories, where your every thought is correct simply because you think it so. Can there be any better definition of hell for a man of learning?
TEXT.French: Imaginez un monde où tout évolue pour s'adapter à votre état d'esprit, où les preuves ne s'opposent jamais à vos théories, où chacune de vos pensées devient correcte juste parce que vous en avez décidé ainsi. Peut-il exister meilleure définition de l'enfer pour un scientifique ?
TEXT.German: Imagine a world where everything changes to match the state of your mind, where evidence never pushes back against your theories, where your every thought is correct simply because you think it so. Can there be any better definition of hell for a man of learning?
TEXT.Italian: Imagine a world where everything changes to match the state of your mind, where evidence never pushes back against your theories, where your every thought is correct simply because you think it so. Can there be any better definition of hell for a man of learning?
TEXT.Spanish: Imagine a world where everything changes to match the state of your mind, where evidence never pushes back against your theories, where your every thought is correct simply because you think it so. Can there be any better definition of hell for a man of learning?

TEXT.English: The tragedy of human life is that, just as you are reaching the peak of your knowledge and skill, your aging body fails you. How can a nation prosper when its greatest minds die off after a mere generation?
TEXT.French: La tragédie de la vie humaine, c'est qu'au moment où vous atteignez enfin le summum de vos connaissances et de vos compétences, votre corps vieillissant vous fait défaut. Comment une nation pourrait-elle prospérer quand ses plus grands esprits meurent à chaque génération ?
TEXT.German: The tragedy of human life is that, just as you are reaching the peak of your knowledge and skill, your aging body fails you. How can a nation prosper when its greatest minds die off after a mere generation?
TEXT.Italian: The tragedy of human life is that, just as you are reaching the peak of your knowledge and skill, your aging body fails you. How can a nation prosper when its greatest minds die off after a mere generation?
TEXT.Spanish: The tragedy of human life is that, just as you are reaching the peak of your knowledge and skill, your aging body fails you. How can a nation prosper when its greatest minds die off after a mere generation?

TEXT.English: Power without wisdom is deadly.
TEXT.French: Sans sagesse, le pouvoir est mortel.
TEXT.German: "Macht ohne Weisheit - eine tödliche Kombination".
TEXT.Italian: Power without wisdom is deadly.
TEXT.Spanish: Power without wisdom is deadly.

TEXT.English: Success is the mark of genius: failure is unacceptable. There are no second chances. Remember that if you wish to survive in the service of our Lord and Lady.
TEXT.French: Success is the mark of genius: failure is unacceptable. There are no second chances. Remember that if you wish to survive in the service of our Lord and Lady.
TEXT.German: Success is the mark of genius: failure is unacceptable. There are no second chances. Remember that if you wish to survive in the service of our Lord and Lady.
TEXT.Italian: Success is the mark of genius: failure is unacceptable. There are no second chances. Remember that if you wish to survive in the service of our Lord and Lady.
TEXT.Spanish: Success is the mark of genius: failure is unacceptable. There are no second chances. Remember that if you wish to survive in the service of our Lord and Lady.

TEXT.English: When prospective adepts first arrive, they are sorted into two groups. The first group is to learn the art and science of demonology, which is at the core of the Sheiam's military strength. The second, less promising group will also serve the One True Art, but in a rather different and more final sense.[NEWLINE]--Excerpt from The Theory and Practice of Human Sacrifice, Vol. 1
TEXT.French: When prospective adepts first arrive, they are sorted into two groups. The first group is to learn the art and science of demonology, which is at the core of the Sheiam's military strength. The second, less promising group will also serve the One True Art, but in a rather different and more final sense.[NEWLINE]--Excerpt from The Theory and Practice of Human Sacrifice, Vol. 1

TEXT.English: We [Balseraphs] are not so strange as you think. We embrace a world of delusions and dreams, yes, but so do you. You simply call these delusions 'laws' and 'religions.' We are more honest.
TEXT.French: We [Balseraphs] are not so strange as you think. We embrace a world of delusions and dreams, yes, but so do you. You simply call these delusions 'laws' and 'religions.' We are more honest.

TEXT.Spanish: We [Balseraphs] are not so strange as you think. We embrace a world of delusions and dreams, yes, but so do you. You simply call these delusions 'laws' and 'religions.' We are more honest.

TEXT.English: Those prating milksops at the academy whine of morality, ethics, and of things man was not meant to know! Bah! And they call themselves sages! What is a sage if he does not make the unknown known? To delve among the secrets of the multiverse, and to uncover the secrets of life ... and of DEATH itself!"[NEWLINE]--Abdulkani, formerly of the Cahir Abbey Academy of Metaphysics
TEXT.French: Those prating milksops at the academy whine of morality, ethics, and of things man was not meant to know! Bah! And they call themselves sages! TEXT.English: Oh, you bureaucrats and your silly rules. Why should those apply to me? After all, I built our secret codes, and where would you all be without those, hmmm? Back to begging for technological scraps from those Bannor thugs, I should imagine. No, I think I'll keep it on me, thanks just the same.[NEWLINE]--when asked to remove her sword before an Undercouncil meeting

TEXT.English: The Body is an exquisite device. So many organs, all so dependant on each other. I've had centuries to perfect my knowledge of the inner workings and innate weaknesses of the body. It is interesting to note, considering it's delicacy, how much damage it can suffer before failing.
TEXT.French: The Body is an exquisite device. So many organs, all so dependant on each other. I've had centuries to perfect my knowledge of the inner workings and innate weaknesses of the body. It is interesting to note, considering it's delicacy, how much damage it can suffer before failing.
TEXT.German: The Body is an exquisite device. So many organs, all so dependant on each other. I've had centuries to perfect my knowledge of the inner workings and innate weaknesses of the body. It is interesting to note, considering it's delicacy, how much damage it can suffer before failing.

TEXT.English: The mark of genius is perseverance in the face of continued failure. Lesser beings quit, assuming their theories are wrong. A true genius will adjust his theories to account for new data, and try again, and again, and again, until he triumphs.
TEXT.French: The mark of genius is perseverance in the face of continued failure. Lesser beings quit, assuming their theories are wrong. A true genius will adjust his theories to account for new data, and try again, and again, and again, until he triumphs.
TEXT.German: The mark of genius is perseverance in the face of continued failure. Lesser beings quit, assuming their theories are wrong. A true genius will adjust his theories to account for new data, and try again, and again, and again, until he triumphs.

TEXT.Spanish: The mark of genius is perseverance in the face of continued failure. Lesser beings quit, assuming their theories are wrong. A true genius will adjust his theories to account for new data, and try again, and again, and again, until he triumphs.

TEXT.English: People complain that the gods do not take any interest in the lives of the common folk. Yet, at the same time, they complain of the overabundance of constellations... what they do not realize is that the gods are touching their lives through these self-same constellations.
TEXT.French: People complain that the gods do not take any interest in the lives of the common folk. Yet, at the same time, they complain of the overabundance of constellations... what they do not realize is that the gods are touching their lives through these self-same constellations.
TEXT.German: People complain that the gods do not take any interest in the lives of the common folk. Yet, at the same time, they complain of the overabundance of constellations... what they do not realize is that the gods are touching their lives through these self-same constellations.

TEXT.English: I have dreamt of a place full of the weapons of the Gods. Imagine what could be done if we could study them.
TEXT.French: J'ai rêvé d'un endroit rempli avec les armes des Dieux. Imaginez ce que nous pourrions apprendre en les étudiant !
TEXT.German: I have dreamt of a place full of the weapons of the Gods. Imagine what could be done if we could study them.
TEXT.Italian: I have dreamt of a place full of the weapons of the Gods. Imagine what could be done if we could study them.
TEXT.Spanish: I have dreamt of a place full of the weapons of the Gods. Imagine what could be done if we could study them.

TEXT.English: "As the time-honored aphorism states, 'Knowledge is power'. And, indeed, that is true. But the power brought by certain forms of knowledge is not worth the price."[NEWLINE]--Willim Marlander, Chancellor of the Cahir Abbey Academy of Metaphysics
TEXT.French: "As the time-honored aphorism states, 'Knowledge is power'. And, indeed, that is true. But the power brought by certain forms of knowledge is not worth the price."[NEWLINE]--Willim Marlander, Chancellor of the Cahir Abbey Academy of Metaphysics

TEXT.English: And so, we pledged to promote the dissemination of knowledge by reason that no borders made by kings and emperors nor oceans and mountain ranges shall extinguish the light of intellect
TEXT.French: And so, we pledged to promote the dissemination of knowledge by reason that no borders made by kings and emperors nor oceans and mountain ranges shall extinguish the light of intellect
TEXT.German: And so, we pledged to promote the dissemination of knowledge by reason that no borders made by kings and emperors nor oceans and mountain ranges shall extinguish the light of intellect
TEXT.Italian: And so, we pledged to promote the dissemination of knowledge by reason that no borders made by kings and emperors nor oceans and mountain ranges shall extinguish the light of intellect
TEXT.Spanish: And so, we pledged to promote the dissemination of knowledge by reason that no borders made by kings and emperors nor oceans and mountain ranges shall extinguish the light of intellect

TEXT.English: Why do we hate the Svartalfar, and why do they hate us? Mere centuries ago both courts broke bread at the table as friends and equals. If my time with your people has taught me anything, it is that no race is predisposed to hate another. I will not rest until once again I see Faeryl and Arendel walking hand in hand through the paths of the Umbralwood
TEXT.French: Why do we hate the Svartalfar, and why do they hate us? Mere centuries ago both courts broke bread at the table as friends and equals. If my time with your people has taught me anything, it is that no race is predisposed to hate another. I will not rest until once again I see Faeryl and Arendel walking hand in hand through the paths of the Umbralwood

TEXT.English: "Cultuum? Spends all his days up in the Tower of Alteration. Apparently he's trying to build a better universe. Some say he's insane. Every so often he'll mention one of his ideas, though... you know what I reckon? If he pulls it off, I'm moving there."[NEWLINE]-Unknown adept on Magister Cultuum
TEXT.French: « Cultuum ? Il passe ses journées là-haut, dans la Tour d'Altération. Apparemment, il essaie de créer un meilleur univers. Certains disent qu'il est fou. Mais de temps à autre, il mentionne une de ses idées... Et vous voulez connaître mon avis ? S'il y arrive, je déménage là-bas. »[NEWLINE]- L'opinion d'un adepte anonyme sur Maître Cultuum
TEXT.German: "Cultuum? Spends all his days up in the Tower of Alteration. Apparently he's trying to build a better universe. Some say he's insane. Every so often he'll mention one of his ideas, though... you know what I reckon? If he pulls it off, I'm moving there."[NEWLINE]-Unknown adept on Magister Cultuum
